reviews.author: Peggy E.
reviews.description: Fantastic intimate wine tour with awesome host, Matthew! Highly recommend to everyone.

reviews.author: Kai C.
reviews.description: Brandy was the best tour guide! My husband and I booked a tour/tasting for my birthday. Masks are worn and there is a plastic divider inside of the van.  The gentleman at Sister Creek who served our wine did great. Brandy was very knowledgeable, personable, professional and kind. She is a walking wealth of wine/vineyard information. If you're looking to book a tour, short or long, I highly recommend this company! We were given the option for her to provide a little info and just let us vibe or provide us with everything. I love all things wine so I went for it all! I wasn't disappointed. (Btw she took magnificent pictures for us as well).

reviews.author: Monica A.
reviews.description: What a great wine tour. Our guide Matt is personable, knowledgeable, funny, friendly and professional. Our group was small. The wineries were great! All cute , the fun one was last; FAT ASS !!! Matt chose wineries based on our taste and personalities. Yes yes you have to do yourself a favor and book a tour. No regrets. They also pick you up at your hotel !

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: First wine tour of the Texas Hill Country and Cottonwood did not disappoint. Our driver/guide Diane was AMAZING! She was super friendly, knowledgeable, and gave great insight into the wines and even hooked us up with a great BBQ joint in Fredericksburg. This was a wonderful experience and we are looking forward to exploring more wines with Cottonwood.

reviews.author: Jen O.
reviews.description: Matt and Brandy were so wonderful! Brandy helped guide us to the best wineries! Matt was our driver and he was very kind, a wealth of knowledge, and a great guide. I would highly recommend working with them for your next wine tour. The pick up and drop off at home were well worth it. Thank you guys for a great time!

reviews.author: Teresa W.
reviews.description: Such a great tour... We did the Guadalupe River Wine tour. It was a surprise for the husbands of the group! Matt was our guide and he was so knowledgeable, friendly and accommodating. A group member left something in the bus and Matt was kind enough to bring it back on his day off. We will definitely tour again!

reviews.author: Manuela F.
reviews.description: A few of us from Houston wanted to do a wine tour birthday party for a friend.  Brandy was super accommodating in the reservation process and her husband Matt picked us up the day of at the hotel we were staying at in San Antonio.  He assured us it would be a very different tour from what we're accustomed do and he was right!  He was so knowledgeable that we really enjoyed the tour.    We had shopping time in Fredericksburg and we never felt rushed.  Excellent recovery on their part too when there was a slight hiccup in our reservation and with what was available to tour, he didn't skip a beat.  He  made other arrangements and we continued our tour.  Additionally, I left my iPhone charger in the van and they had it delivered the same day.  One of my girlfriend's left her sunglasses at the Sisters Creek Vineyards and Matt was able to recover the sunglasses and had them mailed the same day.  That's true service!  We would most definitely enjoy doing another tour with Cottonwood Wine Tours in the future and we plan to do so soon.

reviews.author: Kristie W.
reviews.description: What a great tour!  Diane picked our group of six up at our hotel and the adventure began!  We had our first stop at the Saint Tryphon winery, which was the cutest place with an amazingly knowledgeable and friendly staff!! Tres  presented our tastings and was great to talk and listen to.  Our group of six bought several bottles of wine.  We then journeyed to another gorgeous winery with a little less on the customer service.  We gave our feedback immediately to Diane, who said that she would have a discussion with that winery and I believe she will!  Diane then took us into Fredericksburg and pointed out many local establishments.  Throughout the day, Diane provided many facts and tons of information about the area.  She even managed a quick detour to drive by Luckenbach for us!  We chose this company because it is a small business and were very pleased with the personal touches, snack bags, and intimacy of this tour.  We would highly recommend this company for your wine tour adventures!

reviews.author: James O.
reviews.description: I met my mom and sister in San Antonio for my mom's 65th birthday.  They came by way of Chicago and I came in from Portland, Oregon.  My sister did all of the research for the trip and found Cottonwood wine tours so we could get out of the city and into the hill country of Texas.  It was a Friday and my mom's actual birthday when Matthew picked us up at the hotel.  Right off the bat he was really cool and laid back.  He had a lot of fun facts about San Antonio as he is from there and the drive out to Sister Creek winery seemed like we were just hanging out with a friend.  Coming from the Willamette valley I have seen plenty of winery's but nothing like this one. It is an old cotton mill turned into a small winery that produces some great Bordeaux varietal blends and even a Pinot Noir!  Matthew was very knowledgeable on the topic of wine and wine making.  After the wine tasting we headed to Luckenbach for some beer and a little live country music. There is a lot of history to this place and we had been there 33 years prior when my sister and I were toddlers.  He told us no rush and let us enjoy this little country music Mecca, he even had the famous song loaded up on his phone when we got back to the car.  We had him take a picture of us that emulated the one that had been taken so many years before.  Next stop was some Texas bbq, like real bbq, he said we couldn't expect any city bbq to be better and I would say he was right!  All in all this tour was awesome, I would have loved to take other tours with Matthew, like the Alamo or some of the other missions but I don't think he offers those yet, maybe an idea?  He was very personable, knowledgeable and friendly.  The type of person you want to be around and I know my mom had a very special birthday because of this tour/guide.  I highly recommend Cottonwood wine tours for any tour they offer in San Antonio, it is run by Matthew, his wife and his mother in-law and I look forward to returning here to see their success!

reviews.author: Tam T.
reviews.description: A group of us did the Taste of Fredericksburg tour. We had a great time with Mrs. Diane! She was  friendly, knowledgeable, and had great energy! We visited two wine vineyards and were able to spend the last hour of the tour walking around Fredericksburg. Overall, the tour was amazing! It was put together well and worth the price! I highly recommend doing this tour if you're in town visiting or live in San Antonio. They also give military discounts

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: Great day. Matt was very knowledgeable in history and wine making! He designed tour to group's taste.  Thoroughly enjoyed the hill country and Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Kat O.
reviews.description: Matt was an amazing tour guide!!  I was down in San Antonio for a work trip and happily stumbled upon this tour company in an ad--they even pick you up from your hotel!  Great opportunity to visit beautiful Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Isabella P.
reviews.description: I found Cottonwood Wine Tours while looking for things to do in San Antonio. We had a great time with our driver Diana. We did the 4 winery tour plus free time in Fredricksburg tour, and we had a fun time. Diana is very friendly, and gave us many good suggestions to places to eat in Fredricksburg and San Antonio. I am so glad we found this wine tour company. They are a small operation with Diana, her daughter and son in law.

reviews.author: Charles C.
reviews.description: My wife and I decided to take a trip to the Texas Hill country and do some wine tasting.  We noticed there were over 40 wineries listed and did not know which ones to choose.  So, we looked on the internet and chose Cottonwood Wine Tours.  Our guide was amazing. We learned so much and he chose some wonderful site.  We recommend them highly.

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: I'm visiting my friend in San Antonio who's here for work and she booked this wine tour for us. Matt picked us up and was super friendly and gave us a lot of information about San Antonio, the winery we were headed to, and was just overall really nice and friendly.  At the first winery at Sister Creek, we switched out with Brandy because she was doing the actual tour we booked, Matt was just doing our pick up. Brandy was super fun and every bit as good as Matt. She took us to another winery, let us walk around Fredericksburg (after some great advice on where to eat), then at the end decided she'd take us by a small local liquor distillery that makes some really cool stuff like jalapeno moonshine!  From start to finish, it was amazing. These two are friendly as can be, very knowledgeable, and nothing felt cookie cutter. They make it feel like a personal experience. I definitely recommend giving Cottonwood Wine Tours a try!

reviews.author: Nicole B.
reviews.description: I took 5 ladies today and couldn't have asked for better. Relaxed and fun. Educational and joyful. Perfect.  Wouldnt use anyone else. I cant recommend enough.

reviews.author: Andreea G.
reviews.description: My husband and I went on the A taste of Fredericksburg tour and we had a great time. When they say that you get a knowledgeable tour guide on hand they really mean it. The experience was great and although I am 8 months pregnant we still had a good time and got to purchase some wine to try for after the baby comes. Also they didn't charge me for the wine fee so that was a plus since I didn't get to do any of the wine tastings.

reviews.author: Shirley F.
reviews.description: One word: love. My group took a Sunday tour, and since we were the only ones signed up that day, Matt came to my apartment to pick us all up. He was so polite and interesting, genuinely knowledgeable when it came to wine and the Hill Country. After our first winery, we got back into the car to find goody bags with water and snacks waiting for us. He had extra chocolate if we needed it!    I really liked having time to eat and shop in Fredericksburg between drinking. He pointed out suggestions for places to eat or to drink more on Main Street before dropping us off. He even took us to a bonus winery not on the schedule since we were doing so well on time.   I highly recommend Cottonwood. Matt was easy to contact and professional throughout, even when we were all a bit tipsy. He was a very safe driver. Great job.

reviews.author: Gabrielle M.
reviews.description: I did a private tour of the Guadalupe River Valley area and it was INCREDIBLE. We did a private tour with just 3 and it was completely affordable, which was my biggest concern off the bat. Communication was impeccable from the get-go and our tour guide Matt was such a blast. We hit up 3 wineries and a distillery that made moonshine. Each one was small and unique where we were really able to  converse with the staff and talk about the wines. Due to us having a small group we never felt rushed and when we asked for an extra few minutes, Matt easily obliged. I will definitely be going back for another tour!!

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: If you are living in or visiting in the San Antonio area, you should definitely go on this wine tour!   We did the tour that consisted of two wineries and lunch in Fredricksburg. It was great!  Brandy and Matt think of everything! We were picked up in a clean van right at our hotel, so don't worry if you don't have a car! Matt even bring out a step stool so you don't have strain to get into the car. I didn't need it necessarily, but I did enjoy that extra touch. They gave us goodie bags while we drove to the country side. Matt is very knowledgeable and is a great guide of the area. He is full of little facts about the area!   The wineries we went to were very cool! Sister Creek was in an old cotton gin and more personal. Becker's was more upscale and large. we ended up getting 6 bottles of wine altogether. I was so surprised by the amount of good wine grown in Texas! Who knew?!!  Pros:  Brandy and Matt think of everything!  Don't worry about paying anything at the wineries- they take care of that! Transportation Good wine Great tour of the area Brandy and Matt are friendly and great at conversation They really know their stuff and love to explain anything about wine!  Cons:  I had a hankering for some cheese! But that's all I can think of!

reviews.author: D H.
reviews.description: We loved our wine tour with Taste of the Hills. We visited three wineries with two other couples on the tour. Each stop was unique and Jodie was especially knowledgeable and friendly. She is completely worth trying the tour!   Bonus: we got engaged after the tour!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Jodie was the best!  I found Taste of the Hills on yelp.  I messaged Jodie in April to see what her pricing and availability was for Memorial Day weekend and she responded quickly. Paid deposit through venmo and paid the other half day of our tasting. We did one winery, one distillery and one brewery. She gave us a small history of each of the places we went too. Her cheese board setup was amazing! Very sweet and easy going. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Chandler W.
reviews.description: Jodie made my day all I could have dreamed of. Her bus is super nice, well air conditioned and plenty of space, her knowledge of each winery was very cool to hear and she made sure we were always comfortable! On a warm summer day we were kept cool, fed, and full of wine! Must book with Jodie for a trip around the hill country. Delicious wine and charcuterie board! Thank you Jodie!

reviews.author: Cheryl J.
reviews.description: OMG, Jodie is FaNtAsTiC! My bff and I were on our annual girl's trip and wanted to book a wine tour before we left the Hill Country of Texas. We were staying in the adorable town of Wimberley so I researched tours in the area.  Jodie's Taste of the Hills Tour got great reviews and went to wineries close to the Wimberley area. The day of the tour ended up being chilly and rainy. As soon as Jodie pulled up with her spectacular shuttle-like van she was out like a flash with pretty umbrellas for us! We went to 3 different wineries which we thoroughly enjoyed! After the first one, we returned to Jodie's vehicle and she had a gorgeous tray for us of cheese,  sausage,  crackers,  grapes,  olives, dips.....simply divine!!! The tour was also just the 2 of us and we loved that Jodie still did ALL of this for a tour that I believe takes up to 12 people! The next time we plan a trip to the Hill Country we are going to do one of Jodie's Beer tours!! We had such great conversations with Jodie too! Thank you sooooo much for the GREAT time! Sooooo much fun!

reviews.author: Samantha K.
reviews.description: The owner, Jodie, went above and beyond to make sure my birthday with 12 of my friends and family was a moment to remember and it was just that. She recommended the best of Driftwood and ended up going to Driftwood Estate Winery and Vista Brewery. We spent around 5 hours commuting, tasting, and even an impromptu cellar tour. Thanks again, Jodie! I highly recommend Taste of the Hills to everyone.

reviews.author: Kyle D.
reviews.description: Amazing tour!!! My wife and I came into Wimberley during Spring Break to relax from teaching and this was the perfect trip to do so! Jodie made us all feel like we were old friends, even though we had never met anyone else on the bus.  She was very detailed with the stories of each winery, and explained all the different varietals, answering our every question along the way. The bus was very comfortable and clean, and she stored each bottle we purchased until the trip was over, but we could have had the bottles on the bus had we chosen to.  The wineries all seemed to know her, so they were expecting us and were incredibly friendly. We were not rushed anywhere, and still managed to make it back into town to enjoy shopping on the square.  My wife and I were pretty hungry by the time we had lunch, since we didn't have breakfast, but the tapas style lunch was perfect for the glass of wine we purchased to have with it. The lunch was delicious and filling.  Overall this was an amazing experience and I will be recommending this tour to everyone I know.

reviews.author: Jeffrey R.
reviews.description: Jodie is an exceptional chauffeur.  We had a blast for a friend's birthday! She knew all the great stops and her ride is smooth, comfy, and had a great sound system. We had so much fun!

reviews.author: Sona E.
reviews.description: This wine tour with Jodie is a must.  We got Serenity Inn on a Wednesday so we were lucky to be on the wine tour with only one other couple.  Jodie is such a pleasant and inviting soul. She asked about each person's preferences as to be able to personalize the tour and pick which wineries she decided to take us too.  She is very knowledgeable of the town and the wineries.  The lunch she provides is just amazing. By the time we were done I felt like I had made an incredible new friend. I can't wait to go back and do more tours.

reviews.author: Amber N.
reviews.description: This was such an incredible experience. Jodie picked us up at the Serenity Farm House Inn. She was so friendly and knowledgeable and super sweet. She knew all the best places to go. The picnic lunch she provided was amazing. I wouldn't change a thing about today. I would love to bring some friends and do it all over again.

reviews.author: Brooke K.
reviews.description: Myself,  my Aunt and my cousin took Jodie's winery tour yesterday and had an absolute blast! Jodie really personalized the tour based on our taste in wines. She has an extensive knowledge of wines, the wineries, the towns, etc. Our favorite part was lunch because of the views and the wonderful spread that was provided for us. I highly recommend this tour and in fact will probably we doing it again, soon, I hope.

reviews.author: Amber D.
reviews.description: Perfect - the highlight of our trip!  Jodie was the best, most fun, knowledgeable and coordinator.  We went to Driftwood, Duchman and Fall Creek Vineyards.  We were fortunate enough to have great people touring with us, and it made the tour all the more fun.  She prepared the best picnic lunch I've ever had.  Sugar Shack cake balls, meats, cheeses, crackers, hummus, a goat cheese something served on crackers (that I LOVED, and I hate goat cheese), spinach feta rolls, and I'm sure I'm forgetting something.  She was fully prepared for everything.  Boxes for the wine we bought, umbrellas in case in rained (it didn't), plenty of water...this wine tour couldn't have been more perfect if she tried.  Thanks, Jodie!

reviews.author: Charles J.
reviews.description: Jodie was amazing!  Very knowledgeable and informative.  Has some great stories and makes it very fun.  And the wineries she took us to were fantastic!  I've been to some bad wineries and the Wimberley area has a lot of options and can be daunting to do yourself.  Plus, nice to have a driver.  . Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anita Y.
reviews.description: Jodie was amazing! She asked what our preferences in wine were and brought us to wineries that best fit our palate. She had a delicious charcuterie board waiting for us. Super friendly and very knowledgeable on various places in Wimberley. I highly recommend Jodie!!!

reviews.author: Gwen L.
reviews.description: This was a Fantastic tour. The winery's were lovely and Jodie was the perfect host. Would do it again and recommend to anyone visiting Wimberly.

reviews.author: Amer S.
reviews.description: Jodie was an amazing host and she really made the evening perfect for my wife's 40th birthday! She took us to amazing tasting locations, she knew everyone and we received first class service. She even helped with dinner reservations! It really was an amazing evening largely due to Jodie and the exceptional service she provides! If you are looking for a fantastic wine tour, get in touch with Jodie and she will ensure that happens.

reviews.author: Vicky W.
reviews.description: Ahhhh! So very relaxing! Jodie Meyer knew all the tourists' names and made sure we got to know each other. She provided an excellent variety of foods including a hot portion and gluten-free (just in time `cause I was lit after the 1st vineyard). The three vineyards for that day were selected based on the wine preferences of the tourists that day (A+ perk). We never felt pushed or obligated to buy wines, but we all did because they were very good (!), and Jodie kept our purchases organized and stored for us. She also gave a good background on each vineyard and on the Wimberley area in general. We learned a lot about Wimberley and wine and were able to get tipsy knowing Jodie was an excellent driver of her comfy bus. And have you been to Wimberley? That hilly countryside is beautiful!

reviews.author: Linz N.
reviews.description: We recently went on a fabulous wine tour with Jodie on 4/15 and had a great time!  Our tour was originally scheduled for 10:30a, but got pushed back to 1:15p due to shuttle trouble (we had the option to receive our money back, but actually liked the later time).  We stopped at three wineries, including Driftwood Estate and Duchman Family Winery.  The views at all of the wineries varied, but each were unique to their locations.  Jodie provided an amazing picnic-style lunch, including a charcuterie (meat and cheese) board, chicken salad, nuts, walnut and feta salad, grapes, chocolate cake balls, bottled water, etc. At the second stop, Jodie was kind enough to call in people's orders to Salt Lick BBQ and had it all ready to take home by the third stop.  We can't wait to return again!

reviews.author: Debbie V.
reviews.description: Fantastic wine tour with a knowledgable , fun and personable guide. Jodi made our first wine tour experience a memorable one. Nice travel accommodations   We went to 3 local wineries chosen by our wine preferences. She provided a great tapas lunch and even accommodated the gluten free guests.  I would highly recommend   I will be coming back and doing it again!

reviews.author: Stephanie H.
reviews.description: My mother and I had the most amazing time with Jodi. She was a perfect tour guide and took us to three great wineries. She gave us a lot of background information on the wineries as well as the town of Wimberley. She had a delicious assortment of snacks for us to munch on while we rode to and from each winery. She helped package our wine purchases and brought us umbrellas as it started to rain. She even went the extra mile, literally, and drove us back to our hotel since it was raining as we had walked to our meeting spot earlier in the day. We had another couple on the tour with us which was really nice since we had people to mingle with. It was a very personal experience and I felt as though we were all just great friends spending an afternoon together. Who needs Napa, everything is better in Texas!!! We will definitely be repeat customers.

reviews.author: Lindsey W.
reviews.description: My husband surprised me for a birthday getaway to Wimberley, and we went on this wine tour and had the best time! I had been on another wine tour before in Wimberley, but Jodie made this tour worth it. She knew exactly where to go and even suggested certain wines at each location!   The length of the tour was the perfect amount of time as well. I would definitely recommend this tour and can't wait to go back and visit again!

reviews.author: Mandy G.
reviews.description: If you're looking to visit some wineries in the outskirts of Austin, I recommend it with Arlen!   Arlen was sweet, knowledgable, and funny. He picked us up from our Airbnb and drove us 45 mins out and back, while we blasted some rachet songs to sing haha. He would check in on us during the winery to see if we needed anything or have any questions, and he would offer to help us take multiple pictures. He also got one of the wineries to allow us to explore their cellars!   On our last day in Austin, he drove by our airbnb to pick up someone else and honked at us as we waited for our uber. We were all so happy to see him again, as we all enjoyed our experience with him.   I recommend Texas Tipsy Tours with Arlen ;)

reviews.author: Brittany Z.
reviews.description: I have so many wonderful things to say about this company. I set-up an appointment online to schedule a private driver to Fredericksburg. Ashley called right on time. She was friendly and very informative.  She helped make the experience exactly what I was looking for. I wanted less sweet wines and a winery with food options. Arlen was our diver and was so knowledgeable and friendly. He picked us up right at the hotel in Austin. I felt the price for the experience is definitely worth it. If you were considering this experience, I highly recommend this company. They care and that is important.

reviews.author: Rolanda H.
reviews.description: If your looking to visit wineries or distilleries in the  outskirts of Austin like Dripping Springs and the surrounding area I highly recommend Texas Tipsy Tours. They are organized and timely. If you're an out of towner like myself and decide to book accommodations in Austin they will pick you up from there and bring you back.   All of my future bookings I will definitely request Wade. He was very professional and personable, he made sure we were taken care of at each location on our tour. He also was more than happy to take our pictures along the way.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: We were on a girls trip and were lucky to have Arlen as our driver. He was exceptional, friendly and knowledgeable! He gave us great recommendations for places we were unsure about.

reviews.author: Stephanie T.
reviews.description: Y'all BOOK WITH THEM!!!!! I literally do not have one negative thing to say about this company. From the minute I called to book to the minute I said goodbye to our driver the day of the tour they were fantastic.   So when I called there actually weren't any times available. They worked with me to make sure they had a tour time and sprinter available for our group of 6. I had a million questions; they were patient and kind.   Our group was 6 but one of my friends asked if we could add an additional person. Reached out to TTT and they said sure no problem. Literally 3 HOURS LATER I got a call that another girl tested positive with covid and wouldn't be able to come with us obviously- they were so nice and made the switch back to 6. Very grateful for their exceptional customer service.   Day of our driver Bryant was early which was great! Got on the bus and let us have free range of the radio, answered any wine questions we had or any questions about Fredericksburg. He was a fantastic host. Always texted 15 minutes till our time at the winery was up and took as many pictures as we wanted. He was so sweet! He also made sure we were never thirsty or hungry. Which for a group of girls is very important- smart man! Haha   I've heard things about other companies having hidden fees and people getting charges after leaving Fredericksburg and we had none of that. Texas Tipsy Tours was very transparent with all of their pricing and they had no hidden fees.   Thank you TTT for making our trip perfect. You won't regret booking with them.

reviews.author: Mia L.
reviews.description: Sent a request in and received a response on a weekend afternoon in less than 5 minutes. Incredible customer service, they only fit up to 14 on their vehicles so we were unable to use them, but their owner takes quotes seriously!!

reviews.author: Kelly F.
reviews.description: My experience with Texas Tipsy tours was nothing short of perfect!!! From pickup to drop-off, Courtney (the owner) made our experience amazing! When I initially started inquiring about a tour a few months ago, many of the companies only offered private tours for a minimum of 4 people. However, Texas Tipsy Tours offers small group private tours (i.e. 2-3 people). This was perfect for me. She also made planning our trip so easy, and she promptly answered all of the questions I had.   On the day of the tour, she picked us up from our hotel in Austin in an Infiniti SUV (it was very clean too)! She even made a pit stop for me at a CVS on the way to our first winery. Throughout the 6 hour tour, she made sure we stayed on schedule. She even let us change a stop last minute because we wanted to check out a brewery!  One thing that was amazing was the comfort she provided! She allowed us to pick the music, provided phone chargers, and let us control the AC! She even opened our doors for us AND dropped us off/picked us up right in front of each place we went!  Overall, I highly recommend Texas Tipsy Tours, and I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Audrey C.
reviews.description: Wow!  What an amazing day our group of ladies had with Texas Tipsy Tours.  We chose the half day option and were picked up right at our vacation rental (Farmhouse on Elder Hill) We wanted to just stay nearby so we visited Driftwood Estate Winery and Fall Creek.  We were planning to also see Vista Brewing (all in Driftwood), but we chatted and laughed so much that we ran out of time and Eric, driver/owner was flexible with our change of plans and let us just extend our time enjoying the fabulous view at Driftwood Estate.  The tour service was absolutely awesome and professional.  Everything done with excellence.  Thank you Courtney and Eric!

reviews.author: Ally H.
reviews.description: Awesome experience for bachelorette. Seamless communication with manager Courtney. Helped us make a great itinerary-2 wineries and 1 distillery. Group loved every minute. Driver Keaton was so friendly and professional and best of all company was affordable. Can't recommend enough

reviews.author: Ashton M.
reviews.description: I booked a private wine tasting tour with Tipsy Tours for a bachelorette party and it was seamless right from the start! They took care of everything and even placed our lunch order for us in advance so it was ready when we arrived. It was honestly one of the best tour experiences I have ever had and already booked another tour with them for later this year!

reviews.author: Erin J.
reviews.description: We booked Texas Tipsy Tours twice in one weekend. I have taken quite a few van tours around the hill country and Texas Tipsy Tours sets themselves apart by not just being drivers but they truly host you the entire day. I will ALWAYS use this company going forward. We did a private charter from Driftwood to Austin, TX and back and Keaton our driver was a delight. He made sure we were picked up on time and each of our stops were easy and flexible. We did a mixed tour around Driftwood and Dripping springs the next day and our guide Eric executed the BEST DAY for us. He even picked up on what we were liking and recommended a change to our final stop to Vista Brewing and we were SO glad he did. At each stop he made sure we had plenty of water, snacks and chairs to enjoy the gorgeous venues. This is totally above and beyond what we would have expected from a driver. Courtney was so easy to work with and she helped make recommendations for our group ultimately making our weekend get away FLAWLESS. I promise if you don't use this company, you're wrong.

reviews.author: Chelsea C.
reviews.description: AWESOME! I worked with Courtney at TTT to plan my Husband's 30th birthday brewery tour. It was as easy as getting on the phone, explaining what I wanted, and Courtney took care of literally everything else. We picked the breweries we wanted and even included a food stop. She coordinated the bus pick up, drop offs, schedule, and even reserved tables for us at each stop. I love that we had our own bus (very nice one, by the way!), and had the flexibility to create our own tour based on beers and food my husband liked. It was the perfect Saturday in Austin! Payment was very easy as well - they sent me an invoice to my email and I was able to pay directly online for everything. Highly recommend, and thank you Texas Tipsy Tours!

reviews.author: Kylie H.
reviews.description: Texas Tipsy Tours was absolutely wonderful. They curated a wine tasting for my best friend's bachelorette, and were so helpful and knowledgeable. Courtney and Eric are just the sweetest people! Would highly recommend if you're looking for a relaxed tasting without the hubbub of big party buses, AND if you're looking for a more personalized experience with people who can really throw a party. Fredericksburg can be confusing because of the many, many options, so Courtney's expertise in the wineries proved incredibly helpful. Highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Christy C.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience with this tour company.  They were easy to work with and to plan our day.  We selected the premium wine tour and stopped at 3 wineries and picked up lunch at Hye Market.  The entire experience was well thought out and planned thoroughly.  Courtney is one of the owners and helped me figure out which wineries to taste.  Keaton was our driver and he was great!  I would definitely recommend this tour company.

reviews.author: Nancy R.
reviews.description: Our driver, Keaton, was amazing! He was so polite and kept us on schedule. The places we visited were amazing and so welcoming. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Mitchel R.
reviews.description: Jason was fantastic! I highly recommend him to anybody looking to take a tour of wineries/distilleries.  Great communication, easy to work with, and deeply knowledgeable of the area. He made great suggestions, was flexible as needed, and took great care of us! He even got us a private tour of the cellar at Hawk's Shadow Winery.  Absolutely reach out to him if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Rick M.
reviews.description: Jason was very professional and did a good job planning the day. Could not have asked for a better experience.

reviews.author: Kristoffer K.
reviews.description: From pick up, to drop off the experience was phenomenal! Spacious, clean, and comfortable. An unplanned stop to provide a bathroom break before arriving at our destination was provided upon our request and was greatly appreciated. We ended up losing one of our group and our Driver allowed us to wait and look for them. Additionally, a phone was lost in the furniture and again our Driver provided concern, patience, and assistance in order to retrieve the seemingly stuck device. I have now ridden with this service three times and every time has been beyond excellent.

reviews.author: Julia F.
reviews.description: We used ThunderDome over this past Memorial Day Weekend and had a fantastic experience. Daniel was incredible to work with. He was quick to provide a quote and answer any questions leading up to our trip, and was early to pick us up. 38 of us fit comfortably in the 40 person bus along with all of our belongings. The bus was clean, speakers were great, and Daniel truly went above and beyond for our group. We'll definitely be using ThunderDome for all of our future trips!

reviews.author: Traci S.
reviews.description: Daniel was awesome!  Right from the start he was quick to respond with a quote, details, etc.  Easy to work with and has the little extras like coolers, ice, waters, etc. that went above and beyond.  He was prompt, professional, a safe driver, accommodating and just an overall solid guy.  Would highly recommend for a group large or small!

reviews.author: Kristie L.
reviews.description: AMAZINGGGGG SERVICE! We looked into several party buses around the Austin area and compared quotes. Daniel beat everyone's price AND provided ice and cups when that didn't even cross our minds! THANK YOU THUNDERDOME SO MUCH FROM CAPITOL CHEVY! Definitely using your services in the future! The whole process was smooth, and overall satisfying!

reviews.author: Caitlyn L.
reviews.description: ThunderDome Party Bus was great - Daniel was knowledgeable, friendly and super easy to work with. Couldn't recommend him/ThunderDome enough!

reviews.author: Monika G.
reviews.description: I have used Daniel and ThunderDome Party Bus two years in a row and they are awesome! They're communication is reliable and fast. The morning of, he always calls to let you know he is on time and ask if there are any last minute questions. I've recommended his bus to all of my friends. Everyone has always enjoyed their experience!

reviews.author: Brielle A.
reviews.description: Probably the best quote I got in Austin, especially since the cost included everything we needed! They were even able to make two drop off locations for our party which was really awesome! My friends loved the inside of the bus and we had a great night out, will definitely use again in the future!

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: ThunderDome was awesome! Tony arrived on time and supplied exactly what we were told. He even helped us set up the Bluetooth system for us to play our music. The bus was clean, cool, and ready to party! We took it to a river float for my bachelorette party and it was perfect. Tony even stopped on the way home for a bathroom break. I will definitely book with ThunderDome the next time I need a party bus.

reviews.author: Christa E.
reviews.description: My group of 16 had an amazing time on the Thunderdome Party Bus! Daniel was super accommodating, easy to work with, and a genuinely nice guy. I highly recommend this company for your next group night out. Tip: Go ahead and book an extra hour to whatever you think you'll need - you won't want to get off at the end of the night, it's that much fun!

reviews.author: Maggie S.
reviews.description: We wanted to book a party bus to do a distillery tour. I did not have a lot of information on the distilleries and Daniel was incredibly helpful when figuring out where we should go. We had 19 people on the bus and we had SO much fun. The bus was super clean, Daniel was great and we had the best time. We originally had the bus for 5 hours but Daniel was nice enough to let us add an additional hour to our trip for just a small charge. I would recommend ThunderDome Party Bus to anyone.   We definitely want to plan another trip in the summertime to go floating.  Thanks Daniel!!!

reviews.author: Angelie E.
reviews.description: I booked thunderdome party bus to take a big group of us to float the river. The bus was on time, and even made accommodations to pick up a second group at a different stop. The bus itself was spacious and clean, and everyone had an awesome time! Once we were done floating, the bus conveniently picked us up at the exit of the river. I would highly recommend Thunderdome for big group parties.

reviews.author: Martin G.
reviews.description: This review is long overdue.  I booked the Thunderdome Party Bus for a bachelor party back in May 2017.  The bus was perfect!! Seated our group of 15 comfortably.  The stereo system was bumping, and Daniel, our amazing driver, had no issue with us turning it up to 11.  Our group was most guys in their 30's and Daniel gave us good recommendations on spots to check out that were age appropriate.  In between spots, Daniel drove me to a gas station to help me restock on beer. He even came in and helped me carry and load beers into the coolers.  Great communicate from Daniel from beginning to end, and he someone found the perfect spot to pick us up on busy Rainey St at the end of the night.   Great value and great experience.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Susan B.
reviews.description: We did a private wine tour for my daughters 30th birthday and had a wonderful time.  Winding Road was accommodating and made excellent picks and recommendations for us.  They planned out all the logistics and kept us on track.  I would highly recommend this company!

reviews.author: Tammy B.
reviews.description: Jaston was so cheerful, professional, polite, knowledgeable and fun!! Katie put together a fabulous charcuterie tray that was such a nice touch mid tour!! We will definitely book another tour when back in the area!!

reviews.author: Polly M.
reviews.description: This was an amazing experience. Katie and Jaston are beyond accommodating to make the trip great. They have access to great vineyards, distilleries, and breweries. Will definitely be using them again in the future!

reviews.author: Michelle S.
reviews.description: This was our first time exploring wineries and our driver and guide Jaston was the absolute best! He was very knowledgeable about the areas and wineries. The places he chose for us were top notch and we will definitely use Winding Road again!

reviews.author: Maria D.
reviews.description: This was such a wonderful experience ! My second time coming . Our driver Austin is amazing I gotta give him "kudos " for being so patient with the crowds aNF being so graceful. The owners are amazing as well .  They are always truing to make things right if you feel a slight bit unhappy.  The tours were well worth it.  Every time I go I'm never disappointed. The  service is impeccable. There are three stops very rewarding and very well thought out and put together and the winery stops are spread out Enough to enjoy each place .

reviews.author: Thaddeus B.
reviews.description: This was a great experience, can't imagine touring with anyone else in the Hill Country.  Katie and Jaston extended every effort to fit everyone's plans together and were great communicating the plans and ensuring everyone was happy.  Done tours previously, but not had as much fun as this trip.  They have access to the good and interesting vineyards, in an area where new places pop up daily it seems.  The bus was comfortable, the ride was smooth, and the mood was great.  They have earned our business.

reviews.author: Leticia E.
reviews.description: Had a great time in Fredericksburg! The complimentary personal charcuterie tray was a very nice addition to the tour. The Winding Road bus is nice, clean, and well prepared for any weather (blankets, umbrellas, and water). I highly recommend Winding Road Wine Tours, and I will definitely be using their services again.

reviews.author: Kara G.
reviews.description: Best wine tour ever! My girlfriends and I booked a wine tour for my birthday. The owner, Katie, is beyond sweet! She made sure everything was perfect for us and we got the experience we were looking for. She even went out of her way to give me a list of fun things to do in the area since we aren't local. Jaston, our driver, was awesome! He was our photographer, server, driver, anything we needed he made sure we got it. We definitely will be using Winding Road Wine Tours in the future!

reviews.author: Mark W.
reviews.description: Wow, What an  incredible time my wife and I spent last Saturday touring the Texas wine country with the help of Katie from Winding Road Wine Tours. Her knowledge of the area was impressive.  We are already planning our next trip. Thanks Katie!

reviews.author: Kathy W.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time with Jaston on the wine tour. Katie was integral in helping plan our event. She even made a guest appearance at the end of trip. We loved every minute of it. Thanks for helping us put together the perfect Hill Country Wine Tour. We look forward to many more.

reviews.author: J A.
reviews.description: We had an awesome time with Jaston! He was very knowledgeable, accommodating and explained all aspects of of the tour. The bus was comfortable and super clean. We highly recommend this tour! Thanks Jaston!!

reviews.author: Becky D.
reviews.description: Just had an amazing wine tour with Jaston and Winding Road Wine Tours! Very accommodating, took all the pictures we asked and was very knowledgeable. Would recommend to anyone wanting to spend the day in wine country!

reviews.author: Katie O.
reviews.description: BEST WINE TOUR EVER! Billy is so acccomodating and thoughtful. The wineries that were on the tour had amazing wine and atmospheres. Most certainly  would tour with them again!

reviews.author: Adam S.
reviews.description: My wife and I took this tour and really enjoyed it. A relaxing afternoon in the hill country tasting delicious wines. Billy was a wonderful tour guide.

reviews.author: Jerry S.
reviews.description: Absolutely great trip!  Visited 3 vineyards and all 3 were phenomenal!  Billy with WR tours was a wonderful host!  100% recommend Winding Road Wine Tours!  His bus is very comfortable and very roomy!  And he knows a great deal about the wines!!  Will definitely come back to Wimberley and use Winding Road!!!!!!

reviews.author: Heather T.
reviews.description: Awesome day and Billy was a great  driver and organized everything perfectly.  We would love to do this again!!

reviews.author: Lori C.
reviews.description: We had a great time today with Billy.  A great time with friends for a bachelorette party. Wonderful safe driving, good food and wine!

reviews.author: Paula B.
reviews.description: This is a wonderful wine tour with Billy in the Texas Hill Country. Billy was on time, friendly and very knowledgeable! There were 7 of us on a family vacation trip and we wanted to have a fun but classy wine tour where we got our money's worth and then some. As a new resident to the area, it's important for me to know what high quality tour guides are available. Well, Winding Road Hill Country Wine Tours with Billy is definitely the way to go, folks.

reviews.author: Don M.
reviews.description: Looking to experience great Hill Country wines and barbecue - we had both taking Winding Road Wine Tours Salt Lick Sunday Wine Tour.  The tour picked us up in Gruene in a new luxury bus at 10:30. We were greeted by the tour owner Billy Martin.  The bus was very comfortable with a u shaped seating arrangement and a table in the aisle.  Should seat around 12 people comfortably. The bus has a great sound system that is Bluetooth enabled - Billy played whatever we wanted from sources such as Pandora and Napster music service. First stop was Driftwood Estate Winery. Driftwood has perhaps the best winery views in the Hill Country.  I really enjoyed the reds and came away with a bottle of Longhorn Red to enjoy at our next stop Salt Lick Barbecue. Yes, Salt Lick is byob. It was beginning to rain and Billy dropped us off near the check in stand. He's thought of his customer's needs providing us large golf umbrellas. It was busy with people waiting to be seated. However, he got us seated right away. Our final two wineries were Fall Creek right across the street from Salt Lick and then Wimberley Valley Winery. Fall Creek has solid wines and the service for our group was outstanding. Wimberley Valley Winery was an unexpected pleasure. Their tasting room is roomy and comfortable with plenty room at the tasting bars and a comfortable seating area facing a large stone fireplace. They have a variety of wines bottled on site along with other wines from around the world. The grounds were spectacular with numerous large shaded decks to enjoy a glass or bottle as you wrap up your tour.  What a great Sunday drinking Texas wines, eating Texas barbecue and meeting new friends!

reviews.author: Jaimie M.
reviews.description: Absolutely 5 star experience! Billy was a great host and we all had a blast celebrating our friend's bachelorette party. The bus is extremely accommodating with a great sound system, places for drinks and COLD a/c! (Which was great for the warm weather outside). We had an absolute blast! Thank you so much for taking such great care of us!

reviews.author: Alexia P.
reviews.description: Planned a surprise Bachelorette weekend for my close friend this past November.  Throwing a surprise weekend is stressful enough but Woody was SUPER accommodating especially for being so last minute.  There were many tours that I could've chosen to stick with but Woody was so authentic about his services and was a person of integrity when it came to what he offered.  He personally picked us up from our little hotel we were staying at and drove us to all three of our tours. His tour bus was super clean and we all had a blast! He even offered to pick up some cheese and snacks at the HEB close by to have on the bus if we wanted! I really appreciated Woody taking the time to answer my numerous phone calls with questions I had as this is my first Bachelorette party I threw.  I HIGHLY recommend using Woody if anyone wants to have a great time and looking for someone to trust. I will be booking with you again Woody, thank you so much for everything!

reviews.author: Brad B.
reviews.description: Woody was great, our party had a wonderful time touring Fredericksburg wineries with him and he was very knowledgable about the area and the vineyards.  He has deep contacts at each location and was able to get a very large group into locations that have restrictions due to COVID.  We would all use Woody again when we go back to visit the Texas wine country.  Book with Woody you won't regret it.  Thanks Woody!!!

reviews.author: Christy S.
reviews.description: Blake was our driver; amazing sweet considerate young man! Go to narrow path and arrowhead wineries

reviews.author: Colleen F.
reviews.description: Wow! There are so many choices for wine tours in Fredericksburg that it can be a bit overwhelming. If you come across Fredericksburg Uncorked Wine Tours, stop your search and make the booking.   Organizing a wine tour for 18 girls as part of a bachelorette party was a breeze with Woody, the owner/operator of Uncorked. He gave great advice, offered competitive pricing (especially for the expectant mothers/non-drinkers in our group), and was easy to communicate with. Woody was incredibly patient during the lead up to our tour, and then was a funny, gracious, and attentive guide during our wine tasting experience.   Our tour was fantastic from start to finish, and I can't recommend Woody and the rest of the Fredericksburg Uncorked team highly enough. All (18) of us had the greatest time!

reviews.author: Meggan G.
reviews.description: We had the perfect day with Woody on the Texas 2 Step tour. He kept in touch with us from our booking up until the morning of the tour. He was very friendly, informative and kept us entertained. We learned so much about the area, got recommendations on places to go and heard some great stories along the way! He also made sure to take plenty of photos for everyone in the group. I highly recommend using his services for a great tour of wine country!

reviews.author: Geno C.
reviews.description: Great tour. Great customer service. Will love to go again and stay away from the routine from work.

reviews.author: Katie H.
reviews.description: Woody is amazing! Best driver and tour guide we've ever had.  Super friendly and personable.  Makes sure everyone is having the best experience.  Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: Woody was the best winery your host!! He took our group of 18 for a bachelorette party to three wineries and lunch was included. He took our pictures at each winery and also was very entertaining and extremely nice! He went out of his way to make sure we had a great time.

reviews.author: Kelsey M.
reviews.description: I've been to Fredericksburg twice on big girls trip, and woody was our guide both times - we won't ever go anywhere else! Book your tour, he picks you up and it's literally that easy!  Woody is very nice and knows Fredericksburg and the wineries so well. Don't go anywhere else!!

reviews.author: Julianne D.
reviews.description: Woody is the best guide ever! So accommodating, so nice, and very gracious. Such a great experience- he took such good care of us- I couldn't say enough great things!

reviews.author: Amy U.
reviews.description: This was an AMAZING experience!!! My husband and I are not about organized tours all that much, but this tour was not an organized group of people like a lot of tours are. He went out of his way to text us even before the tour and recommend places for us to go. We loved him so much we even hung out with him after the tour. He is an awesome tour guide and a blast to hangout with and knows anyone and everyone! Can't recommend this tour enough!

reviews.author: TC R.
reviews.description: Had an awesome day with my family and friends. Woody hit all the best spots and we got lit Woody is the man!

reviews.author: Rachael T.
reviews.description: I can't wait to get back to Fredricksburg and have Woody show me around! We had a large group of ladies and Woody took such great care of us. I would highly recommend his services to anyone heading to Fredricksburg!

reviews.author: Catherine T.
reviews.description: Woody was absolutely amazing , my boyfriend and I came into town Thursday 3/17/16 and I really wanted to find a tour for Friday . I called him Friday morning at 8:50 hoping I'd get a call back before the 10 am tour and I did ten min later and I was able to get on his first tour . I honestly called three or 4 more tours throughout the week and left messages and he is the only one that called me back. Not only did woody come through, he came through at the last minute when I thought We weren't going to make a tour.  He was funny , knowledgeable and overall a great guide. He even recommended a few things that weren't apart of the tour (Alamo Springs Cafe) which we ended up going to and was delicious.  Lunch was not included but the place we went to was pretty great for a sandwich . I'd hang out and grab a beer with woody any night !  Thank you for making my boyfriends birthday a good one !!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Woody was lovely and quickly became part of our group. He gave helpful insight into each winery and took so many pictures (patiently!) I wanted to dub him the class historian  Cannot recommend his services enough!

reviews.author: Sue F.
reviews.description: Woody is a funny,helpful, kind and an amazing guy. We were able to book one day in advance. He responded to my call right away and set us up with a 4 person private tour plus lunch. We all had a great time with lots of funny narratives. If you want to see a different side of Texas wineries, just call Woody. He will definitely hook you up.  What a great day with no worries.

reviews.author: Nelcy R.
reviews.description: Woody was nice at the beginning but there was miscommunication about lunch and he decided to take it upon himself to charge my credit card without my permission. I was upset and apparently he was too so he threw customer service out the window. I never agreed to Woody keeping my credit card information on file after he charged the wine tour for 11 girls (almost $1,300).   The driver Tommy was nice but he did nothing special and didn't know the basics of Woody's business. Had he known even a little bit about Uncorked Tours, there wouldn't have been confusion about lunch.   As far as the wine tour: William Chris and Lost Draw were my favorite wineries. Hye Market pretended we weren't there half of the time. Pontotoc was greedy with their pours.   Woody was very unprofessional and difficult to work with at the end. I would not recommend him. Book early to get the highest rated wine tours (2-3 months prior)!

reviews.author: Shannon M.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our wine tour with Bill! He was very knowledgeable and easy to talk to since the other half of our tour cancelled, so it was like a private tour for my boyfriend and I.  We really enjoyed the entire time and highly recommend booking a wine tour through Uncorked!

reviews.author: Brittany B.
reviews.description: We had such a great time with Woody! We were on a bachelorette trip with 15 ladies, and had plenty of room. He picked up our sandwich platters at H-E-B that morning, and set up a little outdoor picnic for us at the second winery. The bus was top of the line, he was a lot of fun, and we would definitely do it again!

reviews.author: Natalie A.
reviews.description: My friends and I went on a wine tour with Woody a few Sundays ago, and it was great! I tried to book for Saturday but the tour was full. I called the number provided on the website and had a great conversation with Woody. He set up the perfect private winery tour for me and my friends on Sunday, since Saturday was full. It was a really great and memorable experience and I would definitely consider doing it again! We had our own spacious limo that we could sip on wine we brought with us, as well as some we purchased at the wineries we visited, while driving from one vineyard to the next (drive time between each location was max. 15 minutes). Overall a great experience!

reviews.author: Tanya R.
reviews.description: You can't go wrong in chosing this company for your tour. David was our guide and he was fabulous. He was very helpful in picking out which vineyards to go to. He did everything possible to ensure we had a great time. Even helped me with getting the best cake ever for a surprise.  You will be very happy!! We will definitely be back! Thanks for everything!!

reviews.author: Anjelah L.
reviews.description: My family and friends booked this tour for my birthday. We had 10 people in the bus and we couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our driver, David was AWESOME!! He had great recommendations and kept us (somewhat) on our schedule! He was a blast! Bus was super roomy and had everything we needed! We will be back and booking with open range again tours again!

reviews.author: J P.
reviews.description: What a great experience!  The 2 Davids were great. We booked this last minute due to the recent snow/ice storm and they were very flexible. We started at William Chris, headed to Pedernales and ended at Augusta Vin. The 15 passenger van was great for our group of 11. They offered water and took care of checking us in at each winery. David was a complete gentleman and carried all of our purchases and secured them in the van while we enjoyed our time tasting the different wines. He even dropped us off downtown so we would be on time for our dinner reservation.

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: I had a driver cancel on me 3 days before my trip. David was so friendly and squeezed in my group through a cancellation he had. He was so nice and really helped us out!!

reviews.author: Lisa D.
reviews.description: David was extremely instrumental in getting a wine tour pulled together, despite many places being shut down (or car-to-go only) due to the latest covid orders. We enjoyed his friendly banter, nice and clean van, and all of the places we went. Will definitely book with David again.

reviews.author: Lauren C.
reviews.description: Absolutely gorgeous day out and about with our guide Mark-he even took us to see the bats after three totally different experiences tasting frozen sangria, fine local wines and tasty beer selection which took us back to Germany! Each location they chose for us was better than the next. Thank you so much for taking us out on a Bad Moms Tour ‍

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Excellent company! Highly recommend! They were prompt and so accommodating for our party. Tour driver even went and picked up lunch for us while we were wine tasting. Don't hesitate to use them for your transportation needs!

reviews.author: Amye B.
reviews.description: Do NOT recommend! We booked a tour for 8 people and everything was a mess from the beginning. We were told we would be upgraded to a 15 passenger bus. A 15 passenger VAN showed up with a dent in the side and ripped seats. We were told we could bring coolers. We were only able to fit 8 adults in the van with our two coolers- no way we could've had another person in the van. None of the wineries had been scheduled yet and the ONE we had specifically requested was not available. We had to scramble ourselves to find wineries, in which we were promised everything would be done ahead of time. The meat and cheese tray that was promised was a small tray that was bought during the tour at a convenient store to feed 2 people. Our driver was great, however the owner did not deliver what was promised and we were highly disappointed. There are plenty of companies to choose from, and I would NOT recommend Open Range.

reviews.author: Shannon Z.
reviews.description: Open Range tours was perfect for our bachelorette wine tour. David was professional and personable. He cared that we were safe and having fun. Once our tour, extended an extra hour, drew to an end, David even recommended transportation for our evening fun. Would definitely recommend Open Range tours and will contact them for future visits.

reviews.author: Keith H.
reviews.description: Open Range Tours is a great company. We've had the owner, David, several times, and we've never been disappointed. He cares about his clients, and goes out of the way to make sure their experience in the wine country is the best it can be. We've used him so much, that we will never use another company when we're in the region. You can't do any better than Open Range, trust me.

reviews.author: Nicole N.
reviews.description: "Double Pimp D" aka David was absolutely phenomenal.  We had a group of 13 in San Antonio go wine tasting in fberg for the day.  He picked us up from San Antonio, drove us up to Hill Country and around to 3 wineries.  As this was my first Texas wine tour, he did an AMAZING job of helping us select which wineries would be a good fit for the group.  As we had a decent amount of guys with us- he suggest Garrison Brother's Distillery which ended up being a HUGE hit!  He was extremely professional, courteous and just an absolute delight to spend the day with!  He also has a wicked funny sense of humor.  He was also very accommodating and ordered and picked up lunch for us so we could continue to enjoy beautiful Hill Country.  I would use him again in heartbeat and highly, highly recommend him to anyone wanting to enjoy Texas Hill Country!  Thanks David!

reviews.author: B M.
reviews.description: David was very helpful in planning a last minute wine tour. He was attentive in making sure we had a great day! He picked places that were just right for what we wanted. Our driver, Lyn, made the day seamless and easy by being flexible and friendly. I would definitely use them again.

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Used David for my wedding at the Lodge and Country Inn Cottages. They had great communication and made the wedding a breeze. Would absolutely recommend them to do a wedding again. Thanks David!

reviews.author: Dustin M.
reviews.description: David is the man! My wife and I had such a great experience. He took us all over wine country. He had great stories and knew all the great places to go. We will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Morgan B.
reviews.description: Awesome experience. D'ann was very helpful and recommend the best wineries in town. JP was a great tour guide. They both went above and beyond to make our experience memorable. Highly recommend Open Range.

reviews.author: Marge B.
reviews.description: I arranged a Girls' Getaway to Fredericksburg, so naturally I wanted to do a wine tour. I contacted several tour companies. D'Ann was extremely responsive and gave me several suggestions of where to go. Since I'm a wine club member at quite a few wineries in the Hill Country, I opted to do a custom tour and made my own reservations. Greg, the owner (and D'Ann's husband) arrived on time and drove us to 3 wineries where we were able to enjoy a nice, relaxing afternoon. Greg was so friendly, helpful and accommodating. I would highly recommend Open Range Tours...thanks, D'Ann and Greg!!!

reviews.author: Casey F.
reviews.description: D'ann went above and beyond for the tour for my sister's bachelorette party!  There were some general issues with scheduling and logistics that were my fault, but she very kindly fixed everything!  Our driver David was on time, helpful, and a lot of fun.  They know a lot about the wineries and have personal relationships with the owners/managers/tasting staff.  David also went above and beyond by making an extra stop for shopping/pie-indulging and by dropping us off at our dinner restaurant so we didn't have to walk from the visitor center where he picked us up.  Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: My winery tour with open range was excellent. D'anne took great care of my group. She texted me several times to keep me updated on the tour and even gave me her personal cell number so that I could reach her anytime. Our driver, Bill, was right on time. He was knowledgeable and very friendly. I highly recommend them for your next tour.

reviews.author: Holly P.
reviews.description: We went to Fredericksburg for a girls trip and wanted to spend a day at the distilleries and breweries. David was fantastic to work with planning everything out. I wouldn't have changed any of that part. But, once the day rolled around we were met with a hiccup. The driver, not David like I was anticipating after multiple conversations, arrived in a mustang for 5 of us. Obviously that wasn't going to work so I was offered by the driver only to cancel or reschedule. Our trip was planned around spending our day out and about so cancelling wasn't an option for us. After a phone call to David, we were assured our day wasn't ruined just a bit delayed. The driver left and showed back up with an SUV and away we went. The driver wasn't interactive and she didn't seem to even be having a good day... It happens I get it but come on. Anyway, we made the best of our day and enjoyed ourselves. When we were dropped off, I tried to pay but she said to get with David. No problem but I did have a problem with her then saying that she'd go ahead and take the gratuity and that the standard is 20%. I didn't even know what our total cost was to figure 20% but asking for the gratuity before I even paid for the day was in poor taste. We did go ahead and tip, and well mind you, because that's the kind of people we are. I ended up calling David and finishing out the transaction and once again, he was a pleasure to deal with. Overall, we'll use them again because I appreciated David that much. But, I'll definitely make sure we don't have the same driver. 5 stars for David but 4 stars overall for the above mentioned.

reviews.author: Vinny P.
reviews.description: Great service! We did a brewery and distillery tour with Cool Bus ATX yesterday. Sam is the owner/driver and one thing she provides is unbelievable customer service. She's extremely easy to work with, provides a fun atmosphere on the bus and is very reasonable priced. I would highly recommend this service to anyone who's looking to get a group of friends together and tour around Austin.

reviews.author: Edwin T.
reviews.description: We had a 12 man bachelor party in Austin during Memorial Day weekend. The day we spent riding around in Cool Bus ATX was the absolute highlight of the weekend. Sam, the owner and driver, was unbelievable. Very accommodating, great driver, and super chill.   We planned to hit up the Salt Lick on the party bus and then venture around to some breweries afterwards. Sam made sure that the group got where we needed to be on time, had great suggestions for breweries, and made sure we were having as much fun as possible.  The bus is great. Fit everyone comfortably with enough room for a cooler in between all of us. Sam had her playlist turned up or she would hand over the AUX cord and we could play our tracks as loud as we wanted. The whole experience was incredibly laid back and worry free. I would absolutely recommend Cool bus ATX to anyone that wants to have a great time with a big group in Austin.   On a side note, if it is Sunday, make sure that you buy beer on Saturday because they don't sell it on Sunday before noon.   Thanks again, Sam!

reviews.author: Bailey S.
reviews.description: We just got back from an amazing weekend with Cool Bus ATX!! Sam, the owner, is very sweet and accommodating. The bus itself is awesome - lights, music (you can play your own music too!), plenty of seating, very well maintained and clean. Would recommend to everyone. Thanks again Cool Bus ATX!

name: Yellow Rose of Texas Wine Tours

reviews.author: Patti A.
reviews.description: Everything was great!  John, the owner was super cool.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: This business is run by a single creep who deceives his clients and thinks he can because it's "his business", even though what was PAID for was denied to us. He is running the business with very unprofessional interactions with his customers and partnering wineries. I would NOT recommend using this company.

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: I booked Yellow Rose 1 month out and had great communication with John, the owner. He ended up being our driver on our own private bus for a 40th birthday trip with 4 crazy girls. He was at our beck and call and did not complain once. We had 3 wine tour stops and then Luckenbach, and it was soooo fun!  All 3 places were each different than the other which gave us a great variety. Thank you John for a wonderful time!

reviews.author: M W.
reviews.description: Our group had a fabulous day with John at Yellow Rose Wine Tours!! It was so relaxing to sit back and enjoy the day with friends, all while knowing every detail had been taken care of.  This coming from a very "type A" personality is a huge 5 star! We did the "red rose" package, touring 3 wineries and had a few hours in Luckenbach.  John was friendly, fun and a great host. All we had to do is drink wine, visit with friends and enjoy the day! If you are looking for a fun experience, try Yellow Rose! We will be back next year to do it all over again!

reviews.author: Sasha F.
reviews.description: Do not use this "tour"!! It is cheaper to pay the tasting fees and hire your own driver. The owner is greedy and a complete A. We originally had 5 ladies who were going on the tour with us and one backed out. We didn't ask for a private tour and John (who I'm guessing is the owner) didn't tell us until we were already at the first location that he would stop the tour until we paid for a fifth person that wasn't there. No wonder he kept pushing cash, it was a complete rip off. It was either go home after that tour paying $125 a person..Or have two more tours while paying for a person who wasn't there. PS it's about $15 for the wine tastings. ($15x3=$45) It was not worth it. On a positive note, Gary at Hanhe Estates winery was amazing. Highly recommend this guy and his wine.

reviews.author: Michaela S.
reviews.description: A couple friends and I decided to go on the White Rose package and had a blast. We visited 2 wineries, a distillery, and a brewery. Our driver, John, was great. He made our experience in the Hill Country one to remember. He was very friendly and kept us on schedule without making us feel rushed. Overall we had a great day and would definitely book again!

reviews.author: Tiffany K.
reviews.description: We were very pleased with John our driver and Cindy's understanding of the wineries.  John helped us learn more about the area and really did a great job accommodating everyone.  Some of us picked up lunch and we ate it at the Fat Ass winery which I would highly recommend. Water was provided and the options at each winery covered all tastes.

reviews.author: Jordan H.
reviews.description: "Tour" is an awfully strong word. We were picked up and then drove for 45 minutes without our driver, John, saying a word about where we were going or how long it would take to get there. He then picked up 3 other people when it was supposed to be a private tour. He took us to the wineries but never said a word about where to go or what to do. He followed us around at the wineries and sat with us. He was 30 minutes late then forgot what the schedule was supposed to be and tried to keep us at the 2nd winery until 30 minutes after we were supposed to be home. He told us we could pay with cash or card, but he only actually took cash or PayPal, which put some people in a real bind. He hounded us about payment the whole time. It was awful and we will never do it again.

reviews.author: Mackenzie W.
reviews.description: I rented a party bus through this company a couple weeks ago. In the beginning, Robert was extremely accommodating and friendly. And our driver, Terrell, was great. We got dropped off at COTA for a show and had a great time!  But where it turned south was at the end of the night. I texted our driver 30 minutes before we needed to be picked up (like he requested) and he said no problem. Then we left the concert and were walking to the pickup spot where I gave him a call. He said he got in an accident but would only be 20 minutes and I said that's fine. 20 minutes roll by and I gave him a call again, no answer, but texted and said it would be another 20 minutes. We ended up waiting in the cold for almost an hour and well after most people had left COTA. Multiple people in our party ended up just taking ubers because they didn't want to wait. The whole point of a bus is so you don't have to wait.  The next day, I texted Robert saying we would like a refund for the extra hour we paid for waiting that we wouldn't have used if we had been picked up on time. He said he would call to discuss but never did. I've now sent him multiple emails - mind you, being incredibly nice about it. All I asked for was an hour refunded back - not the whole thing, not even half. But still no response.  The customer service level of this company is terrible should anything go wrong. So hire them at your own risk.

reviews.author: Neesh S.
reviews.description: Apologies for this review being so incredibly late but Austin Nites was the best! We had rented a party bus on pretty short notice to take a Bachelor Party to and from Lake Travis and Robert and team were amazing.   It was also Prom weekend so the schedule was packed for them but they still took care of us and worked with our schedule.   Our boat ended up staying out on the water longer than scheduled which through our plans all over the place and Robert was there waiting on time. Given his packed schedule, the driver did have to leave without us but Robert made sure to get me in contact with another service and they sent a bus over right away.   All in all, it was an incredible experience!

reviews.author: Snl H.
reviews.description: For $700+ for four hours we would have expected a better looking bus. Multiple dents around outside of bus. The AC barely working. Missing panels inside of bus missing or duct tape together.  Another party bus parked next to the one we had and it was so obvious how terrible looking our bus looked.   Can't believe owners would let this bus represent their company. Hope they use our $700 toward getting it fixed.   Driver was pleasant.

reviews.author: Orlando L.
reviews.description: Had a really great time, would definitely recommend. They did a great job with the event and everything went very smoothly and the price was way better than most other services.

reviews.author: Emersson N.
reviews.description: We took their 16 passenger bus to a soccer game from Austin to San Antonio. Everything was 5 stars, starting with the price and their awesome customer service. They also provided ice, cups and a cooler for us so we didn't have to worry about taking our own. I would definitely recommend them, and will do business with them again. Thank you Robert for the awesome service and thank you Walker (our driver) for keeping up with my crazy friends and brining us home safe.

reviews.author: Charli R.
reviews.description: I'm incredibly frustrated with this business.  We had spoken a couple times in the months before I decided to book and I initially felt great about potentially booking with these friendly people.  When it came time to book I called them and was told, once again, that our requested date was open and we talked out an agreement.  The owner tells me we're good to go, and that all he needed me to do now was to send him my information so that he could get a contract sent that same day.  I'd explained to him that I was booking this bus ride to and from a party boat, and that I would be booking with them that day as well.   SO, I get off the phone and send my info.  I call my party boat folks to let them know I've just confirmed my bus, and I'm ready for a boat.  I book with them based on my discussion with these guys and put down $400 to hold our reservation.  It's been two weeks since I last spoke with this company and they have ignored my calls, texts, voicemails trying to figure out why the contract hasn't come through.  Our event is next month, and at this point I've been researching new solutions, and unfortunately the new solution means I can't use the same boat company, and therefore I've lost my $400 deposit.  I did not have this money to lose, but after being ghosted by this company I guess I have to take the loss and move on.  They seem like nice people, and it takes A LOT to get on here and write a negative review, but this has caused me a lot of stress and I want to prevent this from happening to anyone else.  I hope at some point I find out a reasonable explanation and can revise this review, but not counting on it.  We'll see I guess.

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: Fist off I'm hyper paranoid about drinking and driving so I usually use Uber, Lyft etc to get around town when I wanna go out and when I'm probably going to have a few drinks! But how is that supposed to work when you have a huge group? I called austin nites party rentals for a few reasons 1. I love puns and 2. I'm am austinite and 3. My group was over ten people and we wanted to go out and have nothing to worry about. Great party bus, great personable driver, great experience definitely reccomend these guys!! DONT DRINK AND DRIVE!! Call someone you can trust call Austin Nites!!

reviews.author: Horacio R.
reviews.description: BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!  Robert did a solid job taking me and a bunch of my friends to Lake Travis and back on July 4th. His price was WAY lower than other companies I called, being the ONLY one that actually sticked to his regular prices during this busy day. He arrived early and was 100% responsive to my emails and phone calls. He arrive early to pick us up and was extremely friendly and professional. He helped us carry our coolers and accommodate everything on the bus.  The bus itself is amazing. Seats are stacked in two rows facing each other, which is great for dancing and socializing, since you are actually facing half of the crowd. The sound system is also very good. I almost feel that the bus trip was even more fun that the boat.   In summary, Austin Nites Ent. is the best on price/quality, Robert and his wife are responsive, professional and friendly, and the whole experience I had with them is positive. Would highly recommend anyone to use it, and will definitely consider using them again if I ever need to.  Thank you guys!!!!!

reviews.author: Lisa K.
