reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: Great town to visit. It has something for everyone. If your in the mood to eat and drink, you have many options. If your in the mood to shop, the choices are endless of selection of stores to check out. Great place to go see a show and enjoy. Worth a trip to eat, drink, and be merry.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Great historic spot to wander around.  Many interesting shops and restaurants/bars to visit.  Enjoyed ourselves !!

reviews.author: R G.
reviews.description: Gruene is a fun town to walk around, has great shops and plenty of places to get a snack or have lunch. It was a nice addition to my visit to Austin.

reviews.author: Anita C.
reviews.description: Nestled in New Braunfels this is a great place to people watch, taste some wine, eat good food and hear live music. A few times a month they have something called Gruene Market Days where artists/bakers/creators of all things hand crafted come out and sell their goods.  Restaurants like Gruene River Grill, Grist Mill, Adobe Berde and La Cantina offer great dining and nice views. Gruene Hall is a must stop! Lots of antique shops too. Parking can be hard but be patient and something will open up.

reviews.author: Daryll B.
reviews.description: Gruene is one of the most beautiful, quaint towns I have ever seen. There is so much new construction of new shopping centers, which look like little Bavarian villages, new homes, upscale condos, and of course quaint gift shops, restaurants, and coffee houses.  The bikers love to make it one of their pass through routes, as well as the snowbirds, and river/tube crowd. Come to Gruene for all your antique hunting, shopping, drinking, and even visit one of the many winerys that have daily wine tastings.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: I went in there without my husband looking to get him some good beer, I know nothing about beer-- at all. Just the type he likes.   I got the 6 pack (and got a % off for buying a pack) and brought them home. My husband LOVED the nitro beer I got him. I also got my mother in law a coffee ale. She said it was the best beer she had ever had and she doesn't even like beer. My father in law drank the White Stout. He said it was phenomenal.   Hats off to the owner, for helping me pick out the best beer. And hats off to this store for carrying such a great variety and quality of product! It was amazing!

reviews.author: Brandy B.
reviews.description: I am new to the area and wanted to check this place out and grab a dry cappuccino after pizza yesterday, Monday October 18th around 7pm. I was unenthusiastically greeted by a girl who acted as if I was bothering her by coming into get coffee. I was asking her questions about the place and what they had and she was incredibly rude and continue to answer my questions with one word answers. No smile ever came across her face and she really made me feel uncomfortable as I was just trying to get some information about the store. My family is really big on cigars /coffee/ whiskey and I was very disappointed in the customer service or lack of customer service. I decided to push through and continue with ordering a coffee and when I asked her for a dry cappuccino she proceeded to roll her eyes and told me she didn't know how to make it and asked me what a dry cappuccino was. When I asked her "isn't this a coffee place?" she said "I don't know how to make the coffee I just push the buttons". As somebody that has been a barista and worked at a coffee shop I tried to explain to her how to make it and she just increasingly became annoyed with me. I decided to scratch the dry cappuccino just ordered a double shot of espresso which was awful by the way. As I continued to try to make small talk it was very apparent that I was not welcome there. I even asked her if she wasn't having a good day because of the way I was being treated. As I was paying, I asked her if there was a place that I could leave a review for the store she looked me dead in my eyes and said no. I confusingly asked her, " oh you don't have a Yelp?" She straight up told me no. As somebody that has worked in customer service I have got to say this is the worst customer service I've ever experienced and I would never treat a customer the way that I was treated. I just hope that the owners can see this and know what goes on in their store when they're not there because if I was the owner of the store I would want to know about one of my employees making people feel very uncomfortable And not being helpful at all. I made several attempts to try to turn this experience around and give her the opportunity to create a pleasant experience for me but she just acted like I was interrupting her day of sitting on the stool behind the counter. Customer service was awful coffee was awful she didn't even know how to make a dry cappuccino. If I were you I would steer clear of this place it's not worth it.

reviews.author: Houston R.
reviews.description: WOW!  SO much to choose from!!!  Steve is amazing at helping choose something if you are new or even a novice of cigars, wine, beer and coffee.     Clean, well stocked and excellent customer service. Floor to ceiling stocked with variety!  Something for everyone!  Get your gifts done here!  Cheers!

reviews.author: Dan A.
reviews.description: They have about a billion craft beer brands and types. The carry an assortment of cigars. (I don't smoke though). The gentleman behind the counter, Steve, is super knowledgeable about his beers and stogies. If you enjoy the nicer things, here is your place.  Better pricing than other places on both beer and cigars.   This place intentionally protects it beers and cigars from harmful UV light by putting reflective tint on the front windows and the right amount of illumination inside. That shows seriousness in what they do.

reviews.author: Sean P.
reviews.description: Great customer service. I came for a wedding and was able to find a nice selection of wine from Texas wineries as well as California wineries. Thebseems to have a lot of great cigars everywhere, and the humidors were in great condition. I would definitly come back!

reviews.author: Adrian H.
reviews.description: Loved this place! Great for picking cigars and beers, coffee is really good too. Look forward to going back for more supplies

reviews.author: Alison K.
reviews.description: Great espresso!   Very nice place. Easy stop for great coffee and an excellent beer selection.

reviews.author: Wesley F.
reviews.description: Stopped in after my haircut next door, because I got 10% off after showing my receipt as a promotion, since it just opened. The staff was very courteous and professional; additionally, the store was well stocked with everything, especially different types of sodas from Texas. I would highly recommend this location to anyone looking for a variety of beers, cigars, coffees, wines, and sodas. I am definitely going back soon to get more of the soda!

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: Great craft beer selection and love the idea that I can pick and choose what beers make up my 6pk. Nothing worse than buying a whole 6pk of a beer that you don't like and then stare at the next 5 cans.

reviews.author: G G.
reviews.description: Nice staff Interesting palette of meads S9me good wines too (Rubus was good, Tigers blood mead was good too)

reviews.author: Heather R.
reviews.description: Short visit reaped great rewards.  Mr R had called ahead and been told they had no snack bar/restaurant on site but standard cheese/fruit/charcuterie were available for tastings.  Circumstances changed and I arrived alone at the tasting room's last hour of business. No offer of munchies but the employee was personable, knowledgeable, enjoys his work and I got to taste some *great* stuff in short order. If I'd arrived earlier I'd have asked about a few solids or in hindsight packed a bento box of them in the car to visit between flights.  In wines I tend towards dry, Pinot Grigio's what you can always find at my house and usually in my glass. I also love mead, although what I've consumed over the years is quantum territory compared to my impressive wine quaffing.  I tried four meads and one wine, enjoyed them all. A tasting of 5 selections as I got is $15 and you get to keep the glass. Took home traditional mead (drier), raspberry, Oatmeal Monster, and Vermentino (a drier white wine).  Seriously, if you have a friend who likes sweet wines, you have a shower or other small party on your calendar, come stock up on this oatmeal monster. It's like drinking an oatmeal cookie, it's ridiculously satisfying and giggle-inducing.  The drive's less than 40 minutes from San Marcos, it's near 123 in Seguin not far off my usual path to my parents' and the landscape's as nice as any in this part of Tx. As I said, I didn't have time to wander about on an extensive tour but it looked nice. The map option through Yelp was quite sufficient to get me there easily for a first visit.  They have events throughout the year, the wine club (quarterly delivery/pickup) has no membership fee and I think I'm going to sign up for it. Bottles start around $15 each and there are discounts offered on certain labels/quantities; I saw a few postings for those. The facility's nice if you are making an event of it and there's reasonable parking for split parties to meet up here.  What more can I say? Highlight of my day and now I have new hostess gifts or treats for myself stocked away.

reviews.author: Janean D.
reviews.description: I've visited this winery a few times. Lovely place. Wine and food is great. The staff is very helpful. Patio is beautiful.

reviews.author: Debbie B.
reviews.description: Since trying mead in New England I've been dying to have some more. I'm a new mead fan and enjoy the sweetness and smoothness of it compared to wine. Therefore I was super excited to see this place on a recent trip to the area.   We came in and it was slow. We were the only customers in the tasting room. The super sweet intern was so accommodating and attentive. We really enjoyed chatting with her and trying her recommendations. The property is also very beautiful and scenic. I recommend coming to check this place out!

reviews.author: Bryan B.
reviews.description: Awesome spot, we came for a day trip out here, and I was totally shocked this place existed. Loved every aspect of this place; it was very home-like and welcoming. Ours hostess was kind enough to explain the different styles of mead and wine conjured on the campus. With various samples, I cannot imagine how to choose just one. Their blueberry, raspberry, and original honey take the cake. This place was a real surprise and I would definitely come again and enjoy the scenery and drinks.

reviews.author: Jesse B.
reviews.description: So, really I am surprised that this meadery exists in the middle of "nowhere I'd be going randomly". My mom has been getting into making mead with the fruit trees back home and so, when in Texas, try Texas Mead. Again, this place is way off the beaten road so unless you're aware of their existence, I'm not sure there will be too many coming here.  To start, it was nice and quiet the day my mom and I stopped in, which meant that we got the undivided attention of our hostess. She was highly informative and gracious. My mom had many questions on account of making mead herself, so I just quietly sampled my mead.   Mead is traditionally quite sweet, so if you're not much of a sweet person, find yourself to the wine menu with some drier options. (Yes, along with mead, they have wine here.) The unfortunate ending to our tasting was that the tasting was not comped upon purchase of bottles of wine. (Hmm, maybe with time an popularity this one will go?) Anyway, small gripes, small gripes. So, there is definitely a selection if you're not one who is traditionally into mead.  The last little tidbit I must relish again was their "Hopped Mead". My mom and I decided to drink a glass outside, wandering the winery, and it was incredible. Think somewhat sweet mead but carbonated (that doesn't happen often folks) and hopped for taste. It was so good, my mother bought a growler and we went on our way hoppy. And maybe a little loopy.

reviews.author: Hector B.
reviews.description: Solid experience.  Focused on meads, not the wine.  The meads are not as sweet as expected.  They angled towards port wines to Riesling in taste.  Service was solid and  enjoyable (melinda).  Worthy of a visit! Enjoy!

reviews.author: L S.
reviews.description: Wonderful meads! The blackberry had such incredible flavor. I loved the Desert Pear Pomegranate - very fruit forward. I brought home plenty of mead to share with my friends. I am already looking forward to my next visit!

reviews.author: Rickey B.
reviews.description: Very cool place have fun. Great place to go and spend some time. If you've not been go today opens at noon

reviews.author: Whitney M.
reviews.description: The location is beautiful, the owners are friendly and easy to talk to, and the drinks are delicious. We did the tour and tasting and it was a great way to spend an afternoon.

reviews.author: M H.
reviews.description: Passed this store many times and wondered how serious could a store named "lol" be. Finally stopped and was I wrong! This place super surprised me, it is decked out with liquor from top to bottom, pretty much anything you could ask for. And if they don't have it, they'll get it, just for you. I was looking for a bottle of a special Asian wine, this location didn't have it but another did... and the owner, Paras, delivered it himself within an hour to the store. Owner, Paras, great person, super knowledgable, and way cool. It was Friday night and he had about 6-8 bottles out for samples and gave recommendations on best ways to drink and mix. Gotta try this place. And if you want "high-end" bottles, Paras is the man to talk to.

reviews.author: Travis O.
reviews.description: As a stout beer fan, this is one of my go to places. I have love to watch them expand from a single room and 10 foot wide porch to the multiple building compound they have now. The beers are always delicious, the staff is always extremely friendly, and the addition of the new pizza kitchen is a huge plus.  Last time we were in, we ordered a build your own pizza that included a plethora of delicious meats and even topped it with truffle oil. If you are looking for a fun place to grab a delicious beer, listen to some live music, and eat some phenomenal food, this place that has it all.

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: This is a bring a group type of place. Tons of seating and a great atmosphere. We sat inside by the bar but it was still really hot. We were hoping it would be a little cooler since it was by the bar inside the building but this is Texas after all.   We really enjoyed it and the burgers were so good. We did a flight of beer so we can taste a multitude of what they have to offer. The Peanut butter stout was amazing. The only complaint was the copious amount of flies swarming us, lol. We tried not to let them bother us but they were drawn to our food.   We probably would have stayed longer but the heat and flies got the best of us. We ended up going to a different place to day drink. I think it would be even better during the fall, winter, or the spring.

reviews.author: Sadiya A.
reviews.description: This open patio brewery has a fun and great atmosphere! It's super spacious with the seating area options and one area dedicated to smoking cigars. The beers taste fantastic, especially the bourbon infused one! The brewery also has live music and the band we listened to the night we were there was awesome! There is a second tasting room where you can get flights instead of full tapped beer-that area houses the main brewery area. There is also food at the Guadeloupe Pizza Kitchen which is off to the side of the brewery...the pizza we got that night was the Detroit style pizza, one was veggies and the other pepperoni and it was very tasty! This is a great spot to hangout with family and friends!

reviews.author: Joel G.
reviews.description: After a long day on the river we went in on a Friday being and I'll admit we were a little hangry. Everyplace in NB was packed out and GBC was no exception but it was for good reason, thankfully we didn't let our hunger or the crowd deter us because we would've missed our big time!   So they have two separate building you can order beer at, and a pizza building, pub fare building and taco shack all surroundings common outdoor seating area.  I will say the beer selection and quality was amazing, They had so many unique flavors full of body, light to dark and low ABVs all the way up to 15%! Im so thankfully they weren't 90% IPA which seems like the trend nowadays but truly had a large variety as selection to please everyone.  Their cider was perfect my tart and not sickly sweet like every cider is, super refreshing.  The food was no second fiddle either, and held its own not just against the beer but other rival restaurants with similar fare.  First of pricing is really good so you're not gonna break the bank. Also you get a ton of food for what you pay.  But the icing on top is that the food flavors are soooo good, we had the cheese curds, blue cheese burger from the pub food building at it was honestly one of the best burger ive ever had.  The pizzas were equally as wonderful and had some awesome combinations you don't normally scene but they have them down. We got the one with corrizo and it I think is one of my favorite pizzas now!   This place should be a regular watering hole for everyone! although it's outdoor seating the trees, canvas overhang and mister make it bearable and they really have an ambiance that make you wanna stay and hangout, especially with the live music in the garden patio setting.   As a suggestion/request I will as the business owners to blessed put up some fans! Not just for the heat but the stupid flies especially in the smoking section were super annoying!

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: If you happen to drive through New Braunfels, I highly recommend taking a 10 minute detour away from i35 and traffic to checkout Guadalupe brewing.  It was our first visit since they expanded and it's even better than before. Same great expansive beer options with a lot of new outside space. They also have a separate small batch only bar and overall, their prices are very good. It's also dog and kid friendly and all the people that work there are very friendly.

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: Guadalupe brewing is one of our absolute favorites, and they keep expanding and somehogetting better and better. Amazing flavors and unique beers for every taste ranging from light pilsners to heavy stouts, hoppy IPAs or sour berlinerweiss. They have unique flavors such as dreamsicle, and If they advertise a flavor in a beer it'll definitely be a leading flavor and not slight hints! They have an outdoor seating area that is gorgeous, and an inside area as well. They also have two different bar areas to order from- and some beers are only at one bar and not the other, so check both before you choose! You can get reservations for a week in advance, so they're great for groups/special events. They also serve pizza which is so good! They offer normal or Detroit style, and is an absolute must!

reviews.author: Matt S.
reviews.description: As a native Detroiter and lover of Detroit style pizza, I can honestly say that the Detroit Style pizza here is the best I've had in Texas and possibly Detroit. I had a simple pepperoni pizza and it was absolute perfection 10/10. Better than Via 313 in Austin, which I hold as the standard by which Detroit Style pizza should be measured. One pizza was enough for one person, and I really wanted to order and second but I resisted.

reviews.author: Paige L.
reviews.description: One of my favorite brewery places to enjoy music and friends.  The s'mores brew will always be my favorite but there is a long list of others I enjoy.

reviews.author: Taira H.
reviews.description: Live music and beer on the weekends, what more do you need!? The band they had when we went for the 1st time on a Sunday was amazing.   Lots of seating all around, perfect for dogs and outside hangs. Overall I really enjoyed the beers and the food truck food was really yummy. The food truck will run out of some things so get in line ASAP' if you're hungry. I'd recommend the truffle fries and rib sandwich.

reviews.author: Christine P.
reviews.description: We attended an outdoor ceremony for my BIL at this location. Excellent facility. Great outdoor spaces. Beer was definitely good. I had the kolsch and it was very tasty.  Pizza place right on property so that was great especially for the kids. Pizza was also very good.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Good beer selection. Nice patio area. They also have inside seating. They do have beer flights if you're undecided. The staff is nice and gives good recommendations. Parking is available on site. Dog friendly

reviews.author: Bob H.
reviews.description: We've been with GBC since the beginning.. watching the transformation from small brewery in a tiny industrial building to the sprawling destination venue they are today. We've even slung beer for them on occasion to help out with events and goodwill.  From a "closet" with an outdoor grill on Friday nights, to a full dining and entertaining establishment,  Anna and Keith have never lost focus of their dream even all through Covid they have persevered.  The latest additions of a awning over the beer garden and customer laser engraved new tables to sit, three food choices including a new boffo pizza kitchen, you can't go wrong to stop in, relax and enjoy their hospitality.    Parents... there is a posting on the GBC website, please leave your minor children at home after 7pm. We don't see a lot of adherence to this request and this insults your hosts by being rude and reflects badly on you as a guest.  "Prosit"

reviews.author: Coral U.
reviews.description: This is the great mix between, people, dogs, and beer! The ownership takes so much pride in their work and soon to be legacy. The beer selection is one of the top tier places. I appreciate the live music and crisp cold beer. They have live Texas country music for MULTIPLE times a week. Along with an amazing food as well. I have attached a opening, videos and photos for Sunday morning, and food menus, hours (for food) and more. Hours for the brewery is open tue-thu 5-9 fri-sat 12-9 sun 12-6. The pizza is made with their fresh garden vegetables that you can see them picking tue-thu 5-9 and fri-sat 12-9 (peep my tik-tok, which isn't my thing but it's cute)

reviews.author: Stephanie G.
reviews.description: Everything is great about this place.  The location is perfect, lots to do in the surrounding area.  There is a farmers market on the weekends, the food is delicious, beer menu is very large and diverse and the staff members are awesome!  The seating is very open and there is lots of room.  The price isn't too shabby as well.  Recommend recommend ! If you are in New Braunfels check this place out !

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: This place is so cool and you can find something for everyone to do! They have many options for food. We ordered a pizza and it was delicious. So many different places to sit and many beer options. The ladies at the bar did an excellent job explaining the beers they had on tap.

reviews.author: Law L.
reviews.description: Really great stuff all around. Fantastic pizza. Some great representations of classic styles and some really cool creative funky brews. Enjoyed this immensely

reviews.author: Sheri L.
reviews.description: Nice atmosphere and good selection of craft beer.  Good live music as well.  I'll go back.

reviews.author: Misty M.
reviews.description: The place is cute and clean. The outdoor seating was nice with picnic tables and lounge chairs. You can reserve a table in advance. There was guy playing live acoustic music on stage for a short bit. I got 16oz pour for $7 with nice, friendly bartenders. The low rating is for the food. It was not good. Not the burger or fries nor the service from the lady that look the order. The food was cold, salty, and the burger was all toppings and little patty. I'd definitely return for some drinks and the atmosphere though.

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: Have been a few times.  Have to say they have really good beers (rate them extremely high on Untappd).   My overall experience at the brewery though is mixed.   First, a bit pricey on flights ($20 for 5 beers).  What really annoyed me today was we sat in the nonsmoking section and a worker (owner?) kept coming through with a really pungent cigar.  Multiple trips through and even lingered by us as he smoked.   Totally nullified my ability to taste the beers.  On the bright side, as well as awesome beers, the young man seating guests was super nice and attentive.  He even suggested we move to a cooler spot (the non smoking section haha).   Anyway, mixed experience.  Hence the 3 star rating.

reviews.author: Paula S.
reviews.description: The brewed beer ate all excellent, after a few have a yummy Pizza Margarita, so awesome and tasty, also other Pizza choses, good sandwiches as well. Get over there on the weekend, very enjoyable and relaxing with awesome live music! Come on y'all don't miss out!

reviews.author: Amie W.
reviews.description: This place is a must have for all craft beer lovers.  There is a very diverse beer menu and a beer for even the pickiest of beer drinkers.  Every beer is so flavorful and unique and the staff is very knowledgeable on them all.  The new owners are great and I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Dustin T.
reviews.description: Pretty neat little brewery that features sour beers. There isn't any indoor seating so it could be miserable on a hot day. Fortunately we visited in January and the weather was great.  The beers are pretty good. I would make a return trip.

reviews.author: Krysmrtn M.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this gem waking around New Braunfels.   What a great place to visit!   The beer was great and the customer service was exceptional.  Thank you Michael for a great Sunday!  I highly recommend this place!   So charming.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: Pretty decent establishment with a good variety of beers.  But as someone else mentioned, they specialize in sours.  They did have one Heffe when I was here today, but they said they are discontinuing it and only going to offer sours.  Sours are really not my taste, but to each his or her own.  I sampled a couple of the sours and they were ok, but again, just not my cup of tea, so I won't judge them on that.  Staff was very friendly, very knowledgeable about the different beer selections.  The clientele that we hung out with and spoke with were also very friendly and cool.  Bar area was kind of small but there is also a bit of seating back in the brewing area.  And yes, they do offer flights.

reviews.author: Anthony C.
reviews.description: We stopped by here because our friends live here in town. We are from a micro brew and wine Mecca. And we were throughly impressed with all of the brews here!!! We tried all 8 beers they had on tap at the time of our visit! The blond one and Orono were some of our favs. But the pklfkr was different and good. I also really loved their shivas tears. In all I was throughly impressed. I would HIGHLY recommend this place!!!!!!

reviews.author: Ruby L.
reviews.description: I really liked this spot. It's small and cozy. It was super early when we went. They literally were opening their doors as we rolled in. We stayed for a good hour. The service was good. I see a lot of people complaining about their sours lol. That's literally all the serve! It is a brewery that specializes in sour beer. I personally like sours and ciders so for me it was great, but If you prefer IPAs then this might not be the spot for you.

reviews.author: Caitlyn S.
reviews.description: We definitely hadn't planned to stop by New Braunfels Brewing Co on our last brewery tour, but while we were at Faust Brewing, the bartender let us know they were having an anniversary party. We decided to stop by and see what they had to offer.  It turned out that most of their beers leaned toward the sour end. Sours aren't necessarily my favorite, but I was intrigued by the pickle beer. (Not a fan.) However, they had some dark sours that were actually delicious! This was our third brewery of the day...so that may have influenced my taste buds, but no matter...I still enjoyed them. And the anniversary party was hopping and it seemed like a lot of people love this place.  We'd like to go back and check them out on a non-party day, just to see what they've got. Definitely on our list of places to go again!

reviews.author: Grix P.
reviews.description: Dear city of New Braunfels:  I hope you understand what you have here. New Braunfels brewing Co is in my opinion, one of the best breweries of Texas, definitely the best when it comes to sours (in my humble opinion).  I am gonna go ahead and sound like a pretentious douche, but my husband and I are huge fans of sours, and we have been to over 60 breweries around the country. This one is absolutely a keeper.  The brewery is ran by a family that lives in town, they do everything from cutting the fruit that goes into their beer, to brewing and marketing, so don't expect fanciness, a very small group of people runs the entire show. They are usually very good about updating their menu on facebook.   Remember, this brewery specializes in sours, you will not find the regular styles like Lagers, IPAs and Stouts and such. If you are looking for anything other than sours, please skip it instead of giving it a bad review.  The tap room may be tiny, but it's packed with awesomeness and flavor. The staff is super nice and knowledgeable, and they are always ready to help you and tell you all you need to know about sour beer.  This brewery is not a place to hang out for a long time with your friends, but more of a place for doing a quick tasting and take some bottles home. This is absolutely not a good place for large groups.  I recommend that you buy a flight, which is $8 for 4 small pours, that way you can taste different things. If you want to commit to just one, the prices are very reasonable.   My favorites are Saison de Nefle, Hell yeah! and PKL FKR.  We like their stuff so much that we bought a membership to their club, which is totally worth it.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Do not do business with this company - I have no idea about their product but I leased them a piece of equipment and have had collection problems  - severe - lied to me - STAY AWAY

reviews.author: Frances M.
reviews.description: Sour sour sour. This is place to go when you are not a wimp and willing to try some fantastic beer. Expect sour. Don't come here and taste the beer and make a fuss because you don't like sour beer. My favorite is PKLFKR. YUP. Pickles.

reviews.author: Ibrahim S.
reviews.description: everything is sour.. please think twice before you get anything  we got 2 flight ,it makes 8 different kind of beer  everything was sour

reviews.author: Itsabout T.
reviews.description: Wheats and sours, that's it.  Two beers I never drink but NB Brewery specializes in them.  A small store front brewery in the heart of historic downtown. Very friendly staff were quite informative.  Only the second time I have tried a sour, first time at Jester King and I did not like. They gave me a free taste and off I went.  We quite liked the sours actually better than some of the wheats. We tasted 5 of the 8 taps and liked all but one.   The sours are like a double fermented beer inoculated with live bacteria and can be quite puckering. Some are barrel aged up to a year.  If you're in town I highly recommend stopping in. You can even wander around the small brewery on your own.  Oh btw, they will pour you a cup to go. New Braunfels allows open containers, drink up!

reviews.author: Drew P.
reviews.description: We were just looking for a beer, but I love sours so it was a nice surprise that they specialize in sour beers. I had the Jose rosé gose after sampling a couple of others. Nothing was extremely sour, so this might be a good starting point for someone new to sour beers. Very knowledgeable, friendly staff.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Sweet little brewery tucked into the downtown brewery. Really enthusiastic and knowledgable staff! They can tell you all about their brewery and their beer. Really small inside area, but a nice little beer garden out back. No food.   Also, importantly, if you don't like sour beers - I wouldn't make the trip. That is what they specialize in, and every beer on tap is some form of sour except one.

reviews.author: Dallas P.
reviews.description: I like their beers, even the PKL FKR, but I'm not a fan of sours.   This tasting room is small, no food, but the location is good.

reviews.author: Linday C.
reviews.description: Baby Brewery of Quality and Delight  I'd like to say this is the perfect dive to spend some great relaxy escape time because this place has all the perfect elements of a comforting dive bar (cozy, welcoming, quaint nice and easy and fun as hell) but is decked out very nice and pretty so I'd call this a Posh Dive Bar Brewery.  Yes 5stars of delicious suds. All top notch quality. Impress your friends or woo some opposite sex by taking them here for good times! All the beers I tasted I would buy in a store.

reviews.author: Lindsey C.
reviews.description: I was sooo excited to taste these guys beer. Thier website promised some adventure in a cup. Ummmm DISAPPOINTED, is all I can say.   1. They don't change the website, but to quote the guy pouring, "nothing in life is a sure thing". I'm pretty sure the "on tap now" list is supposed to be a sure thing. Thanks for not only being a Dick, but for wasting my time.   2. All of the beer follows the ode if a little spice is perfect the whole bottle must make it better. Not good. I tried 6 of the 8 beers hoping for one I could finish. NOPE   First clue I should have just turned around was the bartender asking me if I was hungover.  (Nope, but thanks for telling me I look like s°~×  before saying welcome to our brewery)   NEVER AGAIN

reviews.author: Chris P.
reviews.description: If you love sours, this place is for you. Six solid choices but #1 (Blondine) and # 6 (Fyre Dancer) were our favorites. Small inside but outdoor patio available. Did notice very clean bathrooms and Danielle was very friendly.  Recommended...

reviews.author: Kurtis V.
reviews.description: One staff member was awesome and pointed me to some of the best beers I've had AT OTHER BREWERIES!  The other staff member kept interrupting us with irrelevant stories about himself. It was very annoying.  The beers were terrible. All had zero taste because all 8 on tap were incredibly sour. Zero diversity at all

reviews.author: Chiqui B.
reviews.description: We had an accidental run in with this brewery. We happened to spot it as we were getting out of our vehicle on our way to another place. The open sign was calling us, and for it being past 8:00, finding a brewery open that late is unique.  The tasting room is fairly small with a few bar stools and a bench in the brewing room. They  invited me to go in the brew room to take pictures.  These brewers are some of the nicest we've met so far. Great company and conversation. They even recommended some other local businesses, which I now have bookmarked.   The beer: they specialize in wheat beer. That's not typically the style of beer I enjoy, but I did find one called the "Hot Child"- a cucumber and jalapeño infused beer. We only had time to have one beer as their tasting room closes at 9:00. Currently their tasting room is open Thursday-Friday 5-9pm. I hope to see these guys at Wurstfest someday.

reviews.author: Raul Z.
reviews.description: I love this place. Love the outdoors time, hot or cold. Plenty of fire pits to keep warm, nice to sit in the shade in this Texas heat, but I'm used to it. Not for everyone, but they have a place indoors to chill on hot summer days. I'd fire up the pit on a summer night, if they would let me.    They do change the beer menu quite a bit, but they do have there regular beers. Staff is friendly and helpful. Sorry, no beer flights, and I see why, you don't want to get something your not happy with, plus they will give you sample.  They have a kitchen, we've eaten her before, so I can only recommend what we have tried, the pretzels, the pizza, and the bratz.    Now they are about to open a coffee bar, can't wait for that.

reviews.author: Belinda L.
reviews.description: Oh my goodness. My friend Jenn went with my Hubby and I. We arrived during an event they were having. It's so open and spacious outside. The wrought iron seats are comfortable and there's a fire pit. The BEER selection, YUM-0. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Wilma K.
reviews.description: I give them 5 starts because the beers and food are always good. But they need to bring back manmosa beer.  I had the ham and cheese warm and delicious. My husband got the croissant panini, he said it was very good.

reviews.author: Ron K.
reviews.description: So what do you do if you are off the beaten tracks outside of SA.. roaming around from New Berlin to New Braunfels and looking for a bit more  action .. Yelp actually points me me that there is an actual brewery in middle of nowhere, just drive through some windy roads to get there.  Well that seems like a fun adventure on a Saturday afternoon.    Little did I know that this little brewery would be located in the middle of a preserve.  This is where hiking trails meets beers. No masks need rules just some friendly owners ready to talk beer and God's country.   Well let me back up a bit as the hiking part is not quite is not quite available aw of 2021.  But the owners of this wonderful property own all of the acres of this incredible property so maybe this may become the next latest and greatest thing since yoga and beer drinking came to be..  I loved everything about this place.  It was spread out so you could find a spot without being disturbed.  They had picnic tables to hang out under the trees, even rocking chairs for grandma. Totally open to all age groups from the kiddos to oldies but goodies.  Normally I'd not want what could be described as chaos in a normal brewery setting but with the beauty and spaciousness everyone seems to get along and make it work.  Kids and AA/NA 'rs are drinking the hibiscus tea while the majority are enjoying a freshly brewed beer.    Beers are a nice mix here. They have nice light options for the Texas heat like a 4.8% Pilsner kolsch Hefeweizen and orange juice infused pale.  Then they get more serious going to a stout w/marshmallow graham crackers and coco nibs and get all the way to a 9% imperial stout with blackstrap molasses that comes regular or bourbon barrel aged. Those only come in a 6 oz pour which was appreciative considering we all do need to sometime and head back to civilization...  I loved all of the beers especially the Pilsner as it was so refreshing in a hot day.  But even the darker beers were super smooth.  I also loved how they gave you taste tests before committing.     They even gave a bit of entertainment going on with a guitar player on the outdoor patio.  Kids were dancing and adults hanging out with their pets. Yep i didn't see anyone not having a fun time, especially when most people have been deprived so to say over the past year, cough cough:D  This was a great find for us venturers, and I wholeheartedly recommend you bring your friends and family to this wonderful scenic treasure.  Yes Beer does exist in God'scountry. Say Amen to that ..

reviews.author: Sandra D.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a cold one, Goldenboy and Manmosa, very tasty.  There is a lot of shade, cold beer, and a kitchen too.

reviews.author: Jill B.
reviews.description: After driving past twice figures it out! And we were so pleasantly surprised.  Great beer but even better food.  That kitchen!!  Wow!! The best chicken salad croissant I have ever had. Super nice staff.   My son finally got to relax in the rocking chairs on the porch. (Been. Stressful summer).  We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Ben L.
reviews.description: Went for the first time this past Friday and loved it.  The beers were so good.  Some really interesting flavors! My 2 favorites were the Pina Jalapeño beer and the Brothers Keeper!  The pizza was nice too!  Spacious outdoor area with plenty of shade.  Definitely planning on going back.

reviews.author: Julie J.
reviews.description: Great brewery with a real good chill ambiance. Has a wonderful large outdoor area with plenty of trees and perfect for kids to run around in. Beer and food was great too and they even have live music on some days.

reviews.author: Bryan G.
reviews.description: This is a first class family friendly brewery with some very unique beers.  They just get better and better with their improvements to the grounds and sitting areas.  They also have great food trucks which really rounds out a great time.  Highly suggest you visit if you haven't already.

reviews.author: Angela A.
reviews.description: Loved this brewery! Wonderful staff! Beautiful outdoor space. Delicious pizza and great beer. We will definitely return!

reviews.author: Kathy T.
reviews.description: 5 Stones Brew produces some great Brews!! The staff is very kind and professional. The outdoor atmosphere and music is excellent as well as the food.

reviews.author: Jason H.
reviews.description: Awesome family owned joint.  Fresh and delicious beer.  This place is becoming the scene for families and those that enjoy a nice outdoor atmosphere.  Highly recommend you attend on the their events, should not be at all disappointed.  Only struggle they are having is they can't seem to keep pace with all their new fans (aka customers) and they sold out of chow my last visit.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: This place is a little hidden but I think that's what I like about it. Off the beaten path of 1863, snuggled in the countryside with abundant outdoor seating and space for dogs to play and kids to run. There is shade, which is nice but an inside area for those triple-digit days. There are outdoor fire pits for when the weather is actually enjoyable in Texas.  There is usually an on-site food truck on the weekends. The beer is very crafty and creative. My first 2 visits were very excellent. Recently, my trips have still been enjoyable but a bit disappointing. While I admire the creative side of their brews, I do not care for everything to be fruit-infused. I don't mine 1 beer being fruity, but when that is all there is to choose from (other than the Kolsch) it gets old, fast. When I first was visiting this brewery I loved their porters. I haven't seen them in months. I think I would frequent this place like i used to if there were more non-fruity options.  Other than that, I love how it's family-owned, a large, open space, and just a relaxing atmosphere. Hopefully some non-fruity porters or ambers show up soon so I can head back out.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: 5 STONES = 5 STARS!  A bit of the beaten path, BUT YOU MUST GO! One of the coolest breweries I have ever visited. Beautiful location, both the brewery and the gorgeous outdoor seating area.  Feels quintessentially central Texan. LOVE IT. It was made all the more enjoyable by the live music being played the night of my visit. This place would be worth going to if the beer wasn't very good....but that is FAR from the case. The beers are fantastic with a wide range of both familiar and eclectic styles. You can get 5oz pours of anything, enabling you to try quite a few without getting too tipsy. The customer service was friendly as can be. I will 100% be back next time I am in the area. Drink local!

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: What a change from their previous location in Cibolo. They have a beautiful outdoor seating area that is kids friendly and a large selection of beer. I also like their brezel with the sauce.  They had a food truck on the premises when we were there. We definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Ashton M.
reviews.description: This brewery seems to just be getting started, but they're headed in the right direction.  I loved their beers! The facilities were clean and well-ventilated.  I was disappointed that they didn't have all sizes in stock of their merchandise, and they didn't have any to-do cans for sale either. Food trucks would also be a wise improvement, but perhaps they didn't have trucks on the day we came.

reviews.author: John C.
reviews.description: Amazing beers and an open atmosphere. Food looked really good as well. Keep rocking guys!!

reviews.author: Colby M.
reviews.description: Nice brewery in start up mode.   Beautiful facility that looks brand new.   Beers here are really good. When we went they had a lot of fruit forward beers (manmosa, peach beer, dry-hopped manmosa)   There is plenty of outdoor seating. They also have chairs and tables inside.  I'm not sure if the address has been corrected, this place can be tough to find so keep your eyes peeled on approach.

reviews.author: Chad J.
reviews.description: Hymns and Hops...what a fun event! Some friends brought us. Great event! 5 stones is a Christian brewery and apparently they do these live music events several times a year. This one was live Christmas music and awesome beers (and some wines) in an awesome outdoor, family friendly (including the dog) environment that caters to the ability for social distancing. What a cool experience. I was only able to try two of their beers, but both were delicious! I highly recommend both Merry Christmas and Toby G's. All of their beers and made with seasonal ingredients. The Merry Christmas is a fairly typical style Christmas Ale, but delicious. The Toby G's is a family pecan pie recipe made into a beer. Sounded strange, but I love Pecan Pie, so I tried it. So good!! I will definitely come back to this place. Hopefully I'll get to try more of the beers next time. A friend was telling me about a pineapple jalapeño beer they do in the summer time. Sign me up!!

reviews.author: Monica C.
reviews.description: Great place to try new beers, relax and social distance. They allow you to bring your own chairs since it's on a bunch of land so you can enjoy some space

reviews.author: Linda C.
reviews.description: Awesome frozen wine slushy .  Pretzel was soft, warm and delicious.  Will visit again when in New Braunfels.

reviews.author: Bryon T.
reviews.description: Cool spot, great beer selection.   Like the decor.  Visit whenever in town,  which is every couple weeks. Only drawback is the service.  Yes...standard greeting.   But that's where it ends.   Not friendly, consistently, reluctant to answer questions, never engage with us. Like "how's the beer?"  "Have you tried the....?".  Nothing.  And when we do ask questions,  get a short or sarcastic, (looking annoyed) or condescending answers.  People much friendlier at Krauses.  Shame, this place is so much closer to where we stay.

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: I really enjoy trying new beers here. I love that I can choose something on tap or try just one can to see if I like it. If you like something, you can build your own 6pack. If you wanna stay and try things, order the pretzel or the biscuits. There's no wrong answer- though the hot chicken one is hot- be forewarned! (Think hot wing sauce)  they also have some sort of slushee that I meant to try but I forgot because I was distracted by a "sour IPA" and some other interesting things I wanted to try. Try them out, taste some things or wear your mask and build your 6 pack to try at home!

reviews.author: Travis F.
reviews.description: I love this spot, dove by so many times but now I can't help but stop in.  Incredible beer selection; 12 drafts and a wall of niche finds.  My inner beer nerd geeks every time I sit down with a pint.  WONDERFUL selection of cider, gluten free beer and kombucha, and well as butter biscuits and local sausage.  What else could you want?  So happy our town has this spot.

reviews.author: Emily D.
reviews.description: Great selection!!! The owner was very nice too. We took home many can beers we couldn't find anywhere else in San Antonio and the surrounding areas.

reviews.author: Lisa G.
reviews.description: Awesome spot in New Braunfels that offers tons of craft beers.  You can create your own six-packs and the beers are super cheap.  The folks who work here are also super helpful.    There are cold beers ready to go and also beers that are not refrigerated.  Tons and tons to select from.  There is also outdoor seating right outside to enjoy the beers.  We kind of randomly chose our beers, but each one of them was great.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Cool place to come grab some beer, frozen sangria or wine (quite a selection). While the inside is tight and cozy, the outdoors has a lot of seating. It is dog and kid friendly, and a nice place to just sit and enjoy the weather. On some weekends there is a food truck, so that is nice.  Overall the place is clean and very welcoming. There is a lot of bottled beers and ciders to pick from and just a small amount of beers on tap. While I understand that space is probably an issue, I wish they wouldn't carry local beers like Faust on-tap. If I want Faust, I can drive over there. If more taps were available it'd be fine but I'd rather try something else local but not from the same town.

reviews.author: Tawnya V.
reviews.description: We stopped in to have a drink since the owner moved and forgot to tell us.  Does that sound familiar to anyone else out there?  The new place is awesome,  there is a large bar area and seating inside and out. They also now have homemade foods and snacks.  They have the same great selection of Texas beers and a few more.  They also have a huge selection of can and bottle beers you can either drink there or take a six pack home with you.  You will have to try the fire sale (I think that's what it was called). The bartender picks out a beer or hard seltzer out of the cooler, it's fun like a spin of the wheel to try something different.  They now have Sangria Slush which tasted very good and it is also made in house.  I felt very comfortable there, you wear a mask unless you are sitting to drink and eat, they use social distancing, very clean. and the restroom was also very clean.  I felt very safe with the pandemic going on.

reviews.author: Sarah L.
reviews.description: Did not care for this place. The tap beer was not fresh and neither were the bottles on the shelves. The bartender was cleaning up and closing up an hour before closing. Won't return.

reviews.author: W B.
reviews.description: This place is great! They have like 250+ different beers in cans and bottles, and 12 on draft. They also have the most banging biscuit sandwiches. I had a great time, even with COVID stipulations. They ask that you wear a mask when not immediately seated, but you can remove to sip a beer when you are walking around, just remember to put it back on, or they will ask you to do so. Great little spot!

reviews.author: Adam R.
reviews.description: Probably my favorite place in New Braunfels.  Always a rotating selection of draft beers and also cans and bottles too. And only craft beer is served here. No beers from the big conglomerates here! Great atmosphere as well. Indoor and outdoor seating of course.

reviews.author: Lawson H.
reviews.description: Awesome place!! My wife and I stopped in and had a couple of beers!! We had a great conversation with the owner! Definitely a place to check out if you are a craft beer fan or wanting to try different beers!

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Such a fantastic spot! 15ish rotating taps of all local beer. Really well curated selection. Drink local! Great staff and service. No food, but they do have wine. Also have a margarita machine! Over 100 unique beers available in bottles and cans, than you can buy and drink on site, or carry out. You can get on-draft beers in 4oz, 12oz, and pint variations. Cool outdoor area. Lovely, charming spot - should be a must for any lover of beer.

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: The biscuits SLAPPED, the gravy SLAPPED, and the egg SLAPPED. The workers here were so fucking nice and I will be returning everyday.

reviews.author: Drew L.
reviews.description: If you love beer, willing to try new things, and enjoy a cool atmosphere, this is the place for you.   Also, they have board games and corn hole!

reviews.author: Mari H.
reviews.description: Wow! What a place. So many amazing deals on cans I was blown away by selection and price. Dog friendly, clean and good tunes.

reviews.author: Mel K.
reviews.description: Rhodes craft bier station is loaded with wonderful bier.  I'm a lifelong resident of New Braunfels and I'm very happy the Rhodes family opened this Craft Bier bar!!!  The service is first rate, the selection is unmatched in this area, and the product is fresh and tastes great.  Conveniently located downtown across from the LCRA building (Landmark Apartments) and cater-cornered from Wurstfest grounds.  If you're reading this wondering where to go for a great bier, look no further!!!!!

reviews.author: Greg B.
reviews.description: Cool place, good brews, friendly owners, sweet patio area to chill. We hung out here during their grand opening. Very local feel to the place.

reviews.author: Danielle J.
reviews.description: So I thought this was Longshot since that's what my map showed. I was quickly corrected by the sarcastic barkeep. Upside is cute location and tasty mead. (BTW they sell Longshot wine so I'm not sure why the guy was so weird about it). In conclusion, there's potential as long as you don't ask the staff questions. As he may interpret them as dumb and answer you condescending and sarcastically.

reviews.author: Vanna M.
reviews.description: Use to go there when it was a wine bar everyone was so friendly so I thought I would try the new place..horrible..walked in stood at the bar waiting for the dude to acknowledge me...looked at me and went back to watching tv...left pissed..very rude.  Wont be back..way to many other places in nb that are awesome.

name: Faust Brewing Company
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Been here three times and love this place. What a unique experience. You can feel the ghost energy in the old building. But on to the food. You must get the perogies. I hate onion rings but love their onion strings. Every other item we ordered was delicious. Except for the fries. Boring and incorrectly cooked as compared to the tots. Get the shortcake dessert, you only live once. They have their own brews and guest taps, plus a way better than chain hotel hard alcohol bar. Staff appears to be overworked like most places these days.   Trying to not become a regular so that I can still fit in my pants.

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: Quickly becoming our "local" pub.  Good happy hour.  Good beers.  Staff always attentive and friendly.   Good pub grub and ambiance.  Great value for money imo.    Worth trying out.

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: My favorite meal out of the three we had when staying locally! Im going to focus on the things I ate - the Mac and cheese and ahi tuna.   That ahi tuna was the food highlight of my weekend. Ever since COVID, I've been having the hardest time getting quality tuna from restaurants but this dish was perfect. The crunchy slaw added a nice contrast to the to the tuna and sauces. I loved the combination of the multiple sauces. I would drive from San Antonio to new braunfels just to get that tuna appetizer.   I've had the Mac and cheese from here before a few years ago. I remembered it being good and it is! It ended up turning into 2 meals, it's a good amount of food. I like the noodle shape they use and the addition of the veggies. The additional Parmesan toasts on the side are so yummy. Can you ever have too many carbs with cheese?

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: This restaurant/bar is in the back of the Faust Hotel lobby. The atmosphere reminded me of a mini Stanley Hotel. The OktoberFaust beer was fantastic! Extremely diverse menu. We are from Florida and eat in Tarpon Springs (Greek community) regularly. The chicken souvlaki was better than what we get in Tarpon! It came with awesome potato salad and some grilled vegetables. Excellent food, excellent drinks, and affordable - and kid-friendly!

reviews.author: Katlyn C.
reviews.description: First timer - and I really enjoyed it.  We started off with pretzel bites with beer cheese, plus chips and salsa. The beer cheese was a little off, but I really liked the pretzel bites! My husband loved the chips and salsa.  I ordered a cheeseburger with bacon and guacamole and it was one of the best burgers I have had in NB. My husband had the rueben and said it was hands down the best he's ever had.  I also had a couple house margs and they were delicious as well. Overall, I really enjoyed our visit and we will be back!

reviews.author: Peggy E.
reviews.description: Beer cheese soup. Just order it. Eat it up. Name your first born after me. ;-)   The food is always on point here. Every. Single. Time.   What's not amazing is the service. If you sit at the bar, service is good. Sit at a table? Sorry for your bad luck.   The lobby is really nice with antique pieces and a couple pianos. Go check it out! Maybe run into the resident ghosts roaming the property. They're friendly enough. Cool brewery with amazing food.

reviews.author: Carl S.
reviews.description: What an awesome place the 3 people who were here raves about what they ate  Mac and cheese. The sampler hot dogs great flavors for all 3 !!!! The shepherds pie was out of this world . Can't recommend this place any higher . A little tough to find but keep searching worth the struggle haha

reviews.author: W W.
reviews.description: Try the Reuben. It is always meaty and the meat is of good quality. It is one of my favorite Reuben sandwiches ever.  The Faust Hotel is a gym in downtown new Braunfels. Beautiful architecture. Warm and cozy lobby. The restaurant is a bit dark and the floor looks worn and dingy, but the place has a shabby chic about it.

reviews.author: Kevin E.
reviews.description: It's been six years since my first visit and it still holds up.  Great food and a decent selection of beer. Looks like I'm too early for the Oktoberfest brew again, but good enough reason for me to come back.   The German Nachos are killer! You can beat the beer cheese and the brat is delish.   The pretzel bites are a must with the zesty beer cheese.

reviews.author: Kim P.
reviews.description: We went to The Faust for an early New Year's Eve dinner. It was my first time here and I was pleasantly surprised with the service and food. Our server was Maddie and she was fabulous. She was also made our drinks and they were top notch. She got my husbands tequila on the rocks order right and made a very good Mexican martini and French 75! She definitely made our evening great. We had the perogies and German nachos for appetizers. The perogies were excellent, we really enjoyed the shoestring onion rings on top. The German nachos also were excellent. I had the beer cheese soup and French dip. The soup was very good, I was disappointed with the french dip. I think it just couldn't compare to the nachos and perogies. My husband had the corque monsiuer with fried eggs and was very impressed. My son had the Faust Wellington and was also very happy. We will be back soon and highly recommend!

reviews.author: Stacy T.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our food, but were disappointed that our favorite sandwich "The Cuban" was not on the menu, which is why we came.

reviews.author: Kim Y.
reviews.description: My husband and I really enjoyed here. We sat the bar and the staff was friendly and attentive. The food was really good. I got the chicken skewers and my husband got the sausage. Definitely worth trying to out!

reviews.author: Jon W.
reviews.description: Amazing place!   Very friendly and prompt wait staff (Maddy). Had the Rueben and it was absolutely delicious. My wife had the Tuscan sandwich and it was to die for!!!   I had fries and my wife had kartoffel chips.  Both very tasty.  So glad a friend recommended this place. Can't wait to go back and try other things on the menu. Oh yeah they brew beer too but we don't drink so can't speak but if they brew it with the same care as the food I'm sure it's great.

reviews.author: Jelexus M.
reviews.description: Okay let's start with location. It is this little hidden gem located at the back of an historic looking hotel. ..... WHICH IS AWESOME.   Great service.  VERY SPACIOUS.  The food is delicious  I order the mini hot dogs and subbed out the hot dog for brats.  and I wasn't disappointed.   GoodJob Faust.   Oh. and the beer is Vinny's ESP

reviews.author: Joe B.
reviews.description: Really have upgraded their beer. Food is good too!! No issues with service... really good experience!!

reviews.author: Laura O.
reviews.description: Wow, great food, staff and beer.  Friendly and amazingly delicious!  This was our first visit and the staff could not have been friendly.  The Reuben and pierogies were amazing.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: First and foremost - the brewing company is no longer located at the Faust hotel.  It is located nearby at 499 S Castell Ave, New Braunfels, TX 78130.  They have a really nice outdoor patio area with large picnic table style seating, indoor seating at the bar, and also indoor seating in the "hangar" right alongside the brewing equipment.  Their beer selection/variety is good, and the staff are VERY knowledgeable about what the have on tap.  If you are looking for a certain style of beer, ask them and they can probably find one to suit your taste.  They will also give free tastes if you are not sure before purchasing one.    Great local business - show them your love folks!

reviews.author: Rickey B.
reviews.description: Looks like secret is out I didn't review place cause I'm selfish. Best burger in Texas right here it's that simple build your own burger I like the sourdough and the jalapeño fresh made buns but it's killer stuff

reviews.author: Denver M.
reviews.description: Wife and I had about 2 hours to kill prior to picking up the kiddos so we found this place and checked out the hotel prior to going in for a bite. Very cool hotel with an awesome decor and super cool phone booth.  So Luis was our server and he provided very efficient and prompt service. There were several other employees there who were kind of hanging around the bar (bartender + other employee) not really helping out despite 3 tables (7-topand Two 2-tops) walking in within 5 minutes of each other. It was a seat yourself kind of place so I guess none of those tables were in their section?  Anyhow, we got everything ordered and the bartender brought me my beer; kind of a drop and go situation. When I ordered my second beer she tried to deliver it to the table next to us so I'm not sure what was going on.   Food was pretty solid. Reuben was amazingly good. The Russian dressing was made from scratch and had a little spice to it.   The Croque Madame was sinfully delicious but a lot heavier than I anticipated.  The egg yolk really rounded off that dish and would be necessary to complete it. I couldn't have imagined that sandwich without it.   It was a solid experience overall. Decent beer, efficient service, but nothing really blew me away. Wouldn't complain about going back; but wouldn't crave/seek out either.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: While traveling for my company having to pull permits we noticed this place. Once I was done with work, we traveled back to visit here. It was a great atmosphere and the people there were very kind. This is a must try. Great selection of beers

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: This in my opinion was one of the better meals I have had in a long time. We were a large party of 8 and all had different meals. They were all so unique and different packed full of flavor and fun. Our waitress Carson was extra sweet and seemed to make it a priority to make great small talk.   I had the Diablo burger and paid extra for a premium side. They make their own tater tots and they were filled with jalapeños, cheddar cheese and cream cheese. They had a little extra crunch to them but were like nothing I had before.   We shared the apple pie cheesecake which was also good. I would not call it great and a must have but I also think that is because I may have overeaten my meal because it was so divine.

reviews.author: David G.
reviews.description: Their website says:  "The health and safety of our customers and staff is our number one priority. That's why we are continuing to take precautionary measures to ensure proper sanitization and minimal contact for all your orders."  Given this statement it seemed odd that no one in the place (except for me) was wearing masks, and the tables weren't spaced far apart. I would be very uncomfortable dining in here. But my order was for pickup.   I ordered a Caesar salad. The online menu says there's a balsamic reduction, but it was nowhere to be found. That's unfortunate. The salad was a decent size. The dressing was good. It seemed like it was yogurt based. It needed something. Maybe more garlic, or some salt.  The Parmesan crisps were a nice touch, and weren't mentioned on the menu, so maybe they took the place of the balsamic reduction. It's a fair trade off.   I'm on a low fat diet due to some recent health issues, so I think the rest of their menu is off limits for me.

reviews.author: Jen L.
reviews.description: Just Yum. This place has it all. Great service, amazing food, wonderful ambience, the whole package!  Looking forward to my next visit. Our bartender, Fred, was the best!

reviews.author: Tracy S.
reviews.description: This is my favorite restaurant in New Braunfels! Everything I've had is amazing! The craft beers are awesome and their Mucks Cow Mule is my go to cocktail. I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and Buffalo Herd Tater Tots...so good!!! Highly recommend this restaurant.

reviews.author: Ruben R.
reviews.description: Price: 15+  Taste: amazing!  Recommend: yes try it out!  Experience: this place was really good! They definitely have different things that make you explore and try new things! I was iffy with my Diablo burger but man it was the best combination of sweet, spicy, and meaty! The chips with queso was ok, the chips were a little stale and queso was clumpy. The service was amazing, friendly, and swift. Everyone was happy to help and knew their menus pretty well. Our server was also very experienced when it came to draft and crafted beers along with spirits and fund drinks! I would most definitely come back! My mouth is watering just thinking about this place

reviews.author: Dan G.
reviews.description: Fun and Funky Restaurant we went to celebrate our anniversary. There menu was cool and creative and food was seasoned and cooked well. Wait staff was friendly and efficient.   We stopped here on our way up to Austin to celebrate our anniversary. I went with the Mexican Street Food Burger, I think that was the name? ‍ Anyways it was a burger that had a bunch of things on it including Mexican Street Corn. It came with fries which I upgraded to Poutine Fries because why wouldn't I on our anniversary it's time to celebrate. Wifey got Shrimp Tacos with pickled onions on top and I believe some kind of Asian style seasoning. Her meal came with fries as well which she said were good but once she tried my poutine fries she quickly wished she upgraded. We shared my fries because hey it was our anniversary and I'm a nice guy (sometimes).   Overall a good dinning experience. Would reccomend and would return.

reviews.author: Katrice J.
reviews.description: Fabulous food...nice atmosphere.. we enjoyed our time here, relaxing and the burgers were awesome.

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: Stopped by tonight because I saw the Spicy Juicy Lucy listed as one of the best burgers in San Antonio/New Braunfels. Arrived right at five and seated very quickly on the cute patio. Service was quick, and my mouthwatering burger arrived promptly. Definitely lived up to the hype, stuffed with creamy pimiento cheese and stacked high with all the good, non-healthy stuff. Just the right amount of spice too, more about flavor than intense heat. I devoured it quickly because the bun could barely hold it all and I just couldn't resist. So tasty.  Also, the service here was so amazing. My sweet waitress came out to tell me they were fixing my order to get me the sweet potato fries I ordered instead of regular fries. I hadn't even noticed the mistake! I ended up with both sets of fries, and then they didn't charge me for either to make up for their mistake. Superb customer service that sealed the deal for me. Going to recommend this place highly to everyone I know. Hoping to try another burger here soon!

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: We drove by on the way to floating the Comal River and the whole time on the water I was thinking about this spot. Wait was about 15 min for a table for 2. The burgers were awesome. One had pepper jelly, the other with bacon jam.  Service was great. On top of all that, they had live music by Clifton De Leon. He was solid. Played a bunch of country cover songs.

reviews.author: Jelexus M.
reviews.description: Okay so, bring that I used to work here this may be a tinsy bit bias. Nevertheless I'm sure my other reviews can vouch for it. THE BURGERS HERE ARE ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!! The fresh baked buns from the bakery around the corner. Everything is made in house and it's so fresh. They have a HUGE selection of beer as well.  MUST TRY: JALAPEÑO CHEDDAR TATOR TOTES

reviews.author: Kortney K.
reviews.description: I ordered the Scape Goat burger with loaded fries.  Overall-it was pretty yummy! My only complaint, I feel like the patty itself should've been thicker. At one point I was just eating cheese and bun. The jelly is pretty sweet but pairs nicely with the goat cheese. My server Paige was friendly and attentive.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: Was out touring the area looking for a new home (relocating from San Antonio). All I can say is I will narrow my search to live close to this restaurant!    Fantastic place located right downtown. Walking distance from a local hotel. The beer selection would impress a cicerone (certified beer expert). The portions were huge and the staff was great. Gorgeous decor with an indoor and outdoor option.   Fred was our bartender and he was awesome. Great personality too.   I can't attach any pictures because I ate all the food!

reviews.author: Nanette R.
reviews.description: So my Husband heard about this place from a coworker. He warned us there might be a wait to be seated. It look busy but we got a table right away. The decor is nice and they have an outdoor patio area also. I opted to get one of there signature drinks the Muck cow mule and it was delightful and refreshing.  We both had burgers and I had a loaded fry. Both where fresh and flavorful. My Husband loves a good burger and can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: Excellent service and loved the vibe here! Friendly and attentive staff; large draught beer selection; happy hour on M-F from 3-6. Great outdoor space, but it was thunderstorming while we were there.   $17 for a burger and fries is pretty steep though. I got the Scape Goat and the thin beef patty didn't even come close to covering the bottom bun. Disappointing for a burger at that price point. It was flavorful though. Parmesan aioli fries were an up charge; they were pretty delicious.   Basic cheeseburger was deliciously messy and the side salad was beautiful!   We tried the Muck Mule, Peach Sangria, and I had a sample of the Flamingo Fruit beer. All were very good.   Give this New Braunfels gem a try when you're visiting or just passing through!

reviews.author: Caitlin W.
reviews.description: We came here for our anniversary and had a great time. The food was delicious! We got onion rings, the Scape Goat burger, Sweet potato fries, Road Crossing tacos, and loaded fries. We enjoyed them all! It was a neat place, too. Our server was Gus and he was the best server we have had in years.

reviews.author: Asma S.
reviews.description: Best burgers ever! I was kind of hesitant about eating out here as I'm not from the area but I would come right back here the next time I have a chance. The wait was kind of nuts but you are welcome to walk on over to the bar and find some outdoor seating while you wait for a table. It did rain all over us because they don't have a legit cover for outdoor seats but all of that was forgotten when the food came out.   Their fried green tomatoes and onion rings are phenomenal. The burgers were HUGE and they did not shy away from any toppings or condiments. One of our burgers came with an entire bowl of queso to dip or pour. I got a burg with jalapenos and it was so spicy, I had to take some off lol. Delicious meal and very kind service.

reviews.author: Heather J.
reviews.description: Fabulous!  Amazing good food that feeds the weary sun soaked soul. After a day of Schlitterbahn we headed here for supper. It was SO very good! Every burger we ate was specialized and the buns and burgers seemed handcrafted! The Buffalo was watchful. There was outdoor and indoor seating available.  The waitress Kristin was super awesome and amazing and she gave super recommendations!  The menu had different options available. This is also very close to the main circle and river in New Braunfels. The wait can be long in the tourist season. The last day Schlitterbahn was open, we walked right in and got a table at about 645 pm, so it might be slowing down a bit so locals can stop by. We live in Converse and will be back!  We were so full and could not even try the amazing desserts!  Next time...

reviews.author: Kelly B.
reviews.description: What can I say about MandF?   The ambiance is hip yet comfy.  You can dine inside or out.   The restaurant is clean. The employees are nice and they're good at their jobs. It's close to the Comal river. Now, the food!  Muck and Fuss (don't say it too fast or you'll end up throwing an f-bomb) has SUCH good food!  They have a nice variety of dishes like; appetizers and gourmet burgers, sandwiches and tacos, "boozy shakes" or not boozy shakes, and cheesecake for dessert  (unless you want a cocktail for dessert).  Speaking of cocktails, their cocktails and craft beer are SO tasty (and strong) and will get you in trouble if you're not careful. The only complaint I have is the prices.  A couple can easily develop a $50 tab for lunch.  In south Texas, that's kinda pricey. The hub's and I have eaten at MandF a number of times and the meals are consistently yummy and the employees are consistently great.  We just don't eat there as much as we'd like because of the cost. Even with the high prices, I recommend Muck and Fuss!

reviews.author: Ashley P.
reviews.description: The only unpleasant part of dining here was finding a place to park on Memorial Day weekend. We were told we would have to wait an hour for a table of 5 but ended up waiting only 30 minutes or so. We were seated on the patio but had shade and a breeze, so it was pleasant until it threatened to rain, and the host very politely let us know and set a table for us inside. After we moved, it downpoured, so that was very thoughtful!  Our server was very sweet and attentive. We never had empty drinks, and our food was all delivered timely and was hot. I ordered the Scapegoat burger with a side salad. I shared some poutine with my sister. And we got some chips and queso for the table, which was delish. All the food was really good. The Scapegoat with its gooey and melty goat cheese paired with pepper jelly was excellent, great flavor. I should have tried the Asian slaw. The side salad and dressing were good (and fresh), but there isn't much to write about it. The poutine was amazing. It has a mushroom gravy, and my sister hates mushrooms, but she actually loved the poutine.   I didn't get any alcoholic beverages, but it did look like they had a good tap list and some fun cocktails. Note they have Maine Root sodas, so if you are a die-hard Coke or Pepsi lover, the soft drinks are a little different. Two members of my party didn't really care for them. The iced tea was good.   Overall, prices are fair, service is top notch, and the food is worth whatever long wait time they may have!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Great place for food and drinks. They offer cocktail and beer flights. They have a long list of beers to choose from. We tried both. The cocktail flight was perfect. It was a margarita, a mule, sangria and the prince solms sipper.  For food, I ordered the special of the week. It was a sandwich with pimento cheese stuffed fried avocado and a side salad. It truly was perfection. I did also try their Mac and cheese and it was super good. I guess I love cheese and everything I ate had it.  On a Sunday for brunch, it was busy, but we only waited about 20 minutes. We did get seated at the bar. It can get tight, but so worth it.   They have inside and outside seating.

reviews.author: Charlynne A.
reviews.description: Definitely this is a spot to come visit when you want to hangout, lounge around, or pre-game before going to the brewery next door. Either way, this is a cool, low key joint. Best part is that they serve both wine AND coffee! They are the same company as Wicked Voodoo Coffee, and its super interesting that they have a wine and coffee bar. I love it! The concept and the place is so unique. They also have legit charcuterie boards. The staff here is also extremely sweet and nice. Great customer service, amazing ambience, and a great place to bring friends. They also have a private seating area if you wanted to reserve for a large party. If wine and coffee are your jam, this is a perfect place for you!

reviews.author: Lacey G.
reviews.description: Amazing must go to place!! Wish we had this back home! We ordered 4 coffee flights and not one disappointed!!! Cute vibe place!

reviews.author: David R.
reviews.description: Loved it!  Quite Thursday night with my wife.  Great wine and cuturie board.  Excellent staff and they have this amazing nitro coffee on tap!..

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: Super cute little place, coffee, wine and beer and charcuterie boards! All my favorites in one place. The caramel breve is delicious, the staff is friendly and the atmosphere is cute too. Definitely recommend you swing in and visit, hang out!

reviews.author: Allen B.
