reviews.description: Popped in for 1st time.  Nice experience thanks to attentive staff.  New manager (didn't get her name) was super sweet and gave us full background I'm the establishment.   Wife had wine that she really liked so they got high marks for options.

reviews.author: Kevin B.
reviews.description: This place was an amazing experience. The German board was perfect for the palette. I really can't explain how detail oriented they are towards picking the right blend of foods that go so well with their wine offerings.  The bartender/host Stuart was AMAZING. She helped us navigate our flight of wines and has almost perfect recommendations.  I would come here everyday if I could. Being right next to I-35 makes it a short drive for me when commuting, and there was plenty of spots to park even though it was busy.

reviews.author: Jared B.
reviews.description: Charcuterie board, love it. Nice little place, great coffee, great charcuterie boards that go beyond the cheddar cheese and regular boards. The coffee was really good and service was spectacular.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: We absolutely cannot say enough great things about this place... Laurel, the owner, is outgoing, very friendly, funny , and knows her wine.  Sheer delight! Then there is Melinda, who was primarily taking care of us.  She was subbing in from one of their drive-thru locations due to being short-staffed, and she was flat-out nails!  Great personality, extremely helpful, and just a lot of fun to talk with. My wife did have the munchies and ordered the bacon donuts, not really reading the description...obviously missing the 'mountain' in the title.  This is enough to feed Joey Chestnut...a huge pile of freshly made rings, topped with bacon and a sticky-sweet glaze...with a side of healthy fresh berries.  My wife has breakfast for the next few days. Great wine selection...coffee smelled great, but did not have any (got a bag of beans to go), and truly outstanding people... We will go out of our way to visit again, for these experiences, even in today's climate, are rare. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: This is a favorite spot to drop in for a quick glass and delicious cheese board. Highly recommend it!

reviews.author: Jacquelyn C.
reviews.description: What a wonderful hidden gem. We had the Italian Charcuterie board and it was fantastic! The blue cheese was perfect, as was everything else on our board. Our waitress suggested a few wines and let us try them before we purchased a bottle. The staff was incredibly attentive and friendly. We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Aubrey D.
reviews.description: The Caesar salad was meh, but the pizza and loaded fries were great. Soda wasn't great, but the root beer was awesome. Didn't try any beers. We would come back just for the pizza and root beer

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: I have not been to Seguin Brewing since they were in a non climate-controlled warehouse behind a house, down a dirt road in the countryside. Crazy to see them now downtown in a large, beautiful space. Sadly, the beer is, I think, still mediocre. Everything seemed watered down and missing something. Their Heffe and Oktoberfest just didn't taste like that type of beer, and the Pecan is just meh. I was disappointed to see the beer hadn't improved over the years. However, if you do come here, the pizza is phenomenal! There seemed to be only one guy working the kitchen (bless his soul), but he was turning out pizza after pizza and they were so good! I have the Sleek Blue Ribbon and oh man! Drool! I love pesto on pizza but usually it takes place of the red sauce, which I don't like. But here, you get both = win!  I'd say it's worth a stop, but if you're a hardcore beer snob, it may not be to you liking.

reviews.author: Eleanor B.
reviews.description: Well this used to be a fun place for a crowd to gather, management changes have really turned that around. At times surly service and excessively long lines to place food and drink orders make this a pass in my book. Their in-house brews are very nice but some can be found on tap elsewhere, which I highly suggest if you want to try any.

reviews.author: Doug D.
reviews.description: First time customers to this place. We sat at a table. No one even greeted us. Staff saw us sit down. They looked at us like what are you doing here?  Very disappointed  as a friend recommended them.

reviews.author: John N.
reviews.description: So I wish could rate the restaurant and bar separately.    The food itself looked great and customer service was on point...in the restaurant part. The people next to me we raving about the food too.  Love to know if you are making your own crust\dough, but right now I'll give you the benoit of the doubt.  The girl behind the register was KILLING IT: serving tables, making pizza, taking orders, and great attitude.    The bar side: ugh, where do I start, and all in sanitary conditions.  The guy in the green shirt pulled down his mask to talk to everyone, didn't wash his hands once, then used a towel sitting by the bar to wipe down every single inch of my glass.  I just asked for a new glass and poured my beer in there.

reviews.author: Cheryl F.
reviews.description: Came out for a fun date night and while the atmosphere was great the pizza was less than good. It was undercooked and doughy.  I wanted to send it back but the people I was with would not let me.

reviews.author: Dustin T.
reviews.description: Pretty decent brewery located near historic downtown Seguin. They offer a variety of their own brews in addition to some guest taps from other breweries. I believe they also offer some other drinks such as margaritas and wine. The space is pretty cool with lots of room and a hip look. They have TVs to watch the game on. We visited on a Saturday and the service was good and the place wasn't too busy - although it did appear to be busier when we walked by later in the day. There is a kitchen in an adjoining space that serves up some brick-oven style pizza, though we already had lunch plans, and therefore didn't partake - but it looked really good! We enjoyed our visit and would consider a return trip if ever in the area again.

reviews.author: Maria C.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a great way to spend your Thursday evening in Seguin ... then you must check out the Seguin Brewing Company.   We came here on a whim from the office. Sam helped us with setting us up with the private room and keep us in budget. I wasn't trying to have anything formal but I still wanted it to be a nice evening for my coworker was leaving the office.  The food was DELICIOUS and the service was AMAZING  to say the least. We stayed in budget and my party guest paid for their own adult beverages. I feel the need to add this information because the staff did not make it seem at all to be an inconvenience and were so accommodating.   We then leaned it was trivia night and this lasted about 2 hours and we really did enjoy this as it was a great team bonding experience!  Huge thank you to Seguin  Brewery for the memorable evening in Seguin!

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: The thin crust Sleek Blue Ribbon Pizza is delicious, definitely worth trying. I also had the Honey Pecan Cream Ale and I was pleasantly surprised. I was expecting it to be on the sweeter side but it wasn't, it was very smooth and delicious. I ordered to go and my ordering and pickup went great with no issues.

reviews.author: Mark W.
reviews.description: If you like thin-crust pizza, you will love this place--thinnest I've ever seen.  The honey pecan draft beer is also worth a try.

reviews.author: Matt K.
reviews.description: I wanted to give them another star but I couldn't. The kitchen service the last 2 times I came in was bad. Forgotten about both times. The food was decent when it came. My BLT and fires were great. The artichoke dip was bland and the chips were stale.

reviews.author: Becky B.
reviews.description: We went for lunch-all the great reviews were encouraging and we were not disappointed.   Delicious soup, Zuppa Toscana. I think it was kale, potato, sausage-So hearty and tasty.   Pizza was a super thin crust with good sauce, loads of cheese and crispy pepperoni. Perfect. See pic.   Service was warm, welcoming, genuine.  I will return to try their other menu items, they sounded yummy.   I liked that use paper straws and non styrofoam to go boxes.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Day trippin to Seguin. Visited the tulip farm and a few shops on the square, although most of the stores are closed on Sunday. Lots of history to get lost in, regardless of their status.  Arrived as they were opening the doors. Tried several beers, all passably good. Filled the growler for later.   Ordered a couple of pizzas to stave off teenage hangries. Pizza was ok. Definitely wouldn't come back just for it.  Nice space. Nice people. Nice prices. Okay food and beer. I'd like to see what it's like on a Tuesday evening when just the locals are around...  When in Seguin, it's definitely a place to visit.

reviews.author: Sophie Y.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday night; one side had a private party while the other side was for regular customers. They were playing Aggies VS Ole Miss and Houston Astros games.  Lots of different types of beers and pizzas. The sodas are unique too. Overall a good place to hang out or watch a game!

reviews.author: Stephen A.
reviews.description: A friendly brewery,unfortunately I was under awed by the majority of the beers , saying that the porters were good, in the other hand the pizza was phenomenal ! ,so it's worth a visit .

reviews.author: Ian M.
reviews.description: Best pizza in town and their pub fries with house made beer cheese is amazing. They even have a cauliflower crust pizza if you're trying to stay low carb. Our little town's only micro brewery and they're doing a great job representing! Service is always super friendly, too!

reviews.author: Trey C.
reviews.description: Great spot! Beer was good, pretzel was amazing, beer cheese with it was good. The meat board was tasty and the pizza was delicious. Small town place with a friendly staff. Don't pass by or you will miss out on a good time!

reviews.author: Rebecca L.
reviews.description: I'm not a beer drinker but appreciate that they serve mead which is made by fermenting honey. I honestly had never heard of mead until coming here so mead at breweries is rare. The BlackBerry mead is delicious and almost tastes similar to wine. Customer service is always good and very friendly. The environment is super chill. They have 2 TVs and right now during the Astro vs Red Sox game it is $3 pints which is great for beer drinkers. I've been told you can bring food from other places and eat it here. It is also dog friendly and that is a huge plus.

reviews.author: Janean D.
reviews.description: The beer is delicious as always. They have added a great menu. We had the veggie pizza and pub fries, both were delicious! Cook delivered food and was very personable. Picnic benches are not being utilized probably due to covid. Table and chairs are way more comfortable and less awkward. The decor and ambiance needs more work. Maybe some music, and better lighting. Seriously the new menu is great and the quality of food is great.

reviews.author: Jim H.
reviews.description: My wife and I only stopped for a beer. What a great place.  The brewery is on one side and that restaurant is on the other.  Great selection of beers. I liked the Pog Mo Thion.  The New Zealand Common is awesome.  Also tried the Mead. Wow.  I would highly recommend a cold beer here.  Every employee we met was absolutely amazing.

name: Krause's Cafe
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Ariana V.
reviews.description: This is a must stop place for us every time we're in New Braunfels! We've been for brunch, lunch, and to enjoy beers and apps. Honestly, my favorite time to come is for brunch, especially when it's nice enough to sit outside. The ambiance is amazing: brews, live music, and great brunch! Our first time here was for a Mother's Day brunch, which we were fortunate enough to enjoy wonderful weather and got to sit outside and hear some live music! Their avocado toast is delicious: kale, sprouts, and eggs however you like them. It's perfect if you like healthier fare. Some of the skillets and schnitzels are more popular, but I'd honestly get the avocado toast again as it was THAT good.   We most recently came here for my brother-in-law's birthday dinner and really enjoyed it! For starters, the service is amazing. We showed up with cakes, cupcakes, and an ice chest full of ice cream. The wait was an hour long, but they sat us quickly when they realized how much stuff we had brought. They kept the cake in the fridge for us and provided candles and a lighter, which was super nice and helpful! The service alone is reason enough to come back: they truly go above and beyond. For dinner, I ordered the grilled salmon and my husband had the TX BBQ shrimp. My salmon was cooked perfectly and I really enjoyed the potatoes! The shrimp was amazing - I wish I'd ordered it! It had a good amount of heat to it as it also has andouille sausage. It's definitely worth ordering!  As a side note, this place can get PACKED on any given weekend and doesn't take reservations. Something to keep in mind during peak hours if you're coming starving. Overall, can't recommend this place enough if you're stopping in New Braunfels. It's truly a must-do!

reviews.author: Lourna M.
reviews.description: The place is very spacious with a beautiful mural on the outside - I was surprised at how packed with people it was in spite of how large it is. Definitely very popular. The outdoor seating is ginormous! You could tell they were busy but still Emilia, the manager , who was acting as hostess and all around hands on, was very sweet accommodating all who came to her. She was very quick to meet everyone's needs.   I sat at the bar, thanks to Emilia (the first waitress I encountered at the bar was very rude and actually told me there was a wait for the bar and I needed to se Emilia... she was wrong, bar's open seating as in all places). Cynthia ended up being my server. She was wonderful and quick to take my order and check on me for drinks, etc.   They were out of the Wiener schnitzel, which was the reason I originally went, so it was very disappointing. While the ambiance and space and food were great, I was a bit disappointed at the fact that they didn't have such a signature dish so early in the day (noon). I ended up getting a jager schnitzel which felt a bit dry / over fried, but the mushroom sauce was delicious! It was tasty but I'll have to go back and see if it was just bad luck. The fingerling potatoes were well seasoned and delicious. I don't eat boiled cabbage or sauerkraut, but I tasted it and seemed pretty authentic.   They did have quite a varied menu of both food and drinks and most of the waiters and waitresses seemed to be very on top of service. I'll definitely be back in hopes of getting a Wiener schnitzel and maybe try a few other items.

reviews.author: Kelly B.
reviews.description: The hubs and I started eating at Krause's Cafe a couple years ago.  It took us a decade to get there.   We're not huge fans of German food.  Mustard is NOT our favorite condiment.  One day (a couple years ago) we took the plunge and went to the German food mostly restaurant.  YUM!!   But good news turns to even better news!  Krause's is also a biergarten and boy can it be fun!  Hop onto krausescafe.com and see what I mean.

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: Visited again so we could listen to Monte Good and the Honky Tonk Heroes while stuffing our faces with sausages and beer on the patio. It was a nice evening and the heaters took the chill off. Food was delicious, beer was cold, and the band was great!!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Food was good. Service was good. Outside eating area was nice and spacious. Dog friendly on the patio. Plenty of beer on tap. Would go again if in New Braunfels.

reviews.author: Stephen B.
reviews.description: We stopped in because we were hungry for bread pudding and hot cocoa.  We were served something bearing no resemblance whatsoever to bread pudding.  They brought out a cast iron pan with cubed raisin bread swimming in a puddle of butter and sugar. I'm sorry, but in my opinion bread pudding should hold together when removed from the baking pan.  This rendition seemed like cubed bread slathered in sauce.  Where is the cream or milk?  Where were the eggs?  I don't know what it was, but I can't call it bread pudding.  The hot cocoa was hot but not much else.

reviews.author: J.D. J.
reviews.description: We had to try a German restaurant in New Braunfels and everyone said this is the place to go. They have a huge outdoor Biergarten and even the "indoor" Bierhalle is essentially outdoor, with mesh walls and sky high ceilings. Dogs are not only allowed, but encouraged, both in the Biergarten and the Bierhalle. There were several there when we visited and they were all very well behaved.   We ordered a ton of food here, and liked all of it. I'm not usually a fan of shoestring fries, but the ones here were perfectly cooked and seasoned. The broccoli was also prepared perfectly, not over or under cooked. The red cabbage was pickled, making for a unique but very good dish. The Apple fritters were the highlight of the evening. More closely resembling a corn fritter than the Apple fritters you would get at a donut shop, they were crispy on the outside, soft inside and came with a delectable dipping sauce.   A couple of complaints. The live music (a Biergarten staple) was WAY too loud. We had to lean right up to each other's ears to talk to one another. Also, although our main course came surprisingly fast, we had to wait forever for the dessert.

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: This is my second time visiting this restaurant and the rating it has on here fits it well. It is not horrible but not overly fantastic. I can see this as a place to hang out with friends for a beer and finger foods.   The day we went there was a farmer's market so we were occupied while we waited the 45 minutes it took to get a table. I am guessing COVID restrictions play part in this, which is fine. The beers are good! I lived in Germany (Heidelberg, Ketch, and Kaiserslautern) for over 12 years and my husband is French and German, born and raised in Schweinfurt, Germany. Going to German restaurants are a treat for us because we like to compare American German restuarnt to the originals. All American German restuarnat cater to the Bavaria region of Germany and this one does a great job mixing both American and German style foods.   I had the Texas schnitel, which I did not care that much for. My husband had the German meatball which was amazing. The brussel sprouts are some of the best I've tasted since moving here.   In all, this is a fun place to hang out with friends and family. They have live music, which I would have hoped was traditional German, but hey! I do see myself visiting a third time.

reviews.author: Luis N Felicia P.
reviews.description: Food here was good. We ordered a bunch of appetizers and a burger for my picky daughter. Service was ok. Young guy serving us was focused on 2 tables with 9+ people. We had to hunt him down just for refills, which he forgot 2x. First impressions, meh. Will give it another try just to see if the service gets better.

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: Man the food here is straight out LA-GIT!  We took my father-in-law here for his 70th birthday because he wanted some German food and this place did not disappoint! The schnitzel was fantastic and the beer cheese sauce was delicious as an appetizer! They have plenty of great German beer options and I would love to come back here again! The brown mushroom gravy was delicious and they have a cool outdoor seating area and bar as well.

reviews.author: Mcnamara D.
reviews.description: Nice venue for good beer and authentic German and other food. It was chilly and we brought dog, so we ate outside. Live music awesome. Nice beers. Had a nice meal, and  would be five stars, except for the very cold potato latke I had with my expensive and otherwise nice pork shank. I sent it back twice and waiter Porter didn't comp any of it. Unfortunate for a $30 entry.

reviews.author: Richard D.
reviews.description: Stopped by yesterday for brunch.  The Bauern Schnitzel was excellent!  Large pork Schnitzel topped with Hollandaise, two poached eggs, hash browns and a biscuit.  House potatoes and toast are other options.  Excellent service, great hot Artisan coffee and hot, fresh, light biscuits.  Everything was perfect for me. No complaints!  Give it a try!

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: To be honest I'm don't remember the food so I guess that made for a great experience lol.  Beer was cold, ambiance was great, and customer service was on point.

reviews.author: Erin F.
reviews.description: Best Sunday Brunch we have had - food was amazing but the service was poor. Our food came out before our drinks did!

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: This place is really cute and has a large beer selection. Service was good, we were in there a hour before closing and it was not busy at all. Menu is not updated at all. All the beers I tried to order were not available. We ordered the large pretzel with the mustard sauces and cheese sauce. The cheese sauce was fantastic and I enjoyed the honey mustard as well. My son and I split the German meatball with spatzle. The meatball wasn't very hot but it was good. Nothing spectacular but it was good. Good size portions. My boyfriend ordered the Texas schnitzel and it was ok, a bit dry and over cooked. The green beans were ok and the mashed potatoes were way too salty. They would've been great with less salt. The beers we had were the liters abd they were served in a huge mug. Those were perfect.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Changing my rating from last time. Service and draft German beer selections have gotten a lot better. Still hit or miss on the table service, but overall they have it down. Being very cautious about distancing and masks.  New and updated menu which has some great items on it. Sad that they got rid of the fried cinnamon rolls but I will live.

reviews.author: Katlyn C.
reviews.description: So surprised I haven't written a review for here yet.  My favorite things to eat here: rueben with chips (so so good), soft pretzel with beer cheese, and the kartoffel poppers!  They have a ton of beers on tap, you're likely going to find something that you enjoy. They even had an Apple Pie Mimosa today and it was delicious. There is tons of space outside, and the beer garden area. (Only downside is that when they have music it is LOUD) I've never eaten on the real inside before, it's never been an option so I'm not sure how to get a seat in there?  The only reason for 4 stars is because service is consistently poor. I also tried 2 desserts today and was disappointed in both. (Bread pudding and chocolate cake, no ice cream because the machine was down)

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: We love this place! Like love it for real. Great food, service, and live music. We come here a lot and we have never been disappointed. Just a great place to come and hang out and have fun.  It can be busy on the weekends so be prepared to get on the list and wait for 30 minutes or so. They will text you when they have a table. There are tables to use while waiting so you can get some pre-meal drinks if you like.  The food is just good here. My wife had the carrot cake and she absolutely loved it. I had a pretzel and we both had some drinks. This was just a fun Saturday afternoon!

reviews.author: Philip B.
reviews.description: Rude service! Haley greets you and acts like you're doing her a favor asking for a table. After saying 30 minute for a table we were seating 8 minutes later.  We waited for 15 minutes later and had to flag down a server. For the third time in a row we were told that there's a limited menu for no good reason other than the "kitchen is slow." So no kartoffel poppers.....the best item on the menu. After bringing appetizers we waited 40 minutes and were told by server that she forgot to put in our order.  The manager (Sabrina) was unapologetic and asked if everything else was timely. What else?? No entrees came out and nobody asked if we wanted more drinks.  Don't waste your time here...and it is a waste.   Last few visits have been bad. Its a shame. This place used to be good. Lots of room to make something better in New Braunfels. Owner needs to wake up. Great spot but going down hill.

reviews.author: Kevin Z.
reviews.description: Great venue!  Food is fantastic and the servers are fast and courteous.  It's become our "go to". Dogs allowed as well!

name: AquaBrew
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: My husband I drove to SM from Austin for a school event. Weather and traffic were crazy and we missed the event. We were both disappointed and decided to find a place to eat to salvage the night. That's where AquaBrew came in. The environment of AB is warm and comfortable. The service is nice, attentive, and happy. And the food and beer...  My husband got the fried chicken sandwich and I got the pulled pork sandwich- the spicy slaw was delish. Both were really tasty and hot, fries were crispy and salty. The IPAs were delicious with the food.  Definitely looking forward to the next chance I have to go back.

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: We visited AquaBrew after eating at Industry next door. This brewery has many great beers on their list. I enjoyed the San Marcos Blonde.  There is plenty of indoor seating, a great patio and of course the bar area.  It was easy to social distance from other people and very clean. We will return. The staff was very nice and helpful. If you are looking for a good local brewery to support, AquaBrew is the place.

reviews.author: Shawna L.
reviews.description: Their new location wasn't updated on any maps so we ended up waking all around it until we called to find out what else we could use on maps to locate them. When we walked in we were very disappointed in their craft selection. I had researched this prior to choosing to go there based on their craft choices showed online. Again, something else that needed to be updated. Also, they aren't serving food. There was a large dog walking around that would come right up to you or sneak up under the tables and lick your feet. I like dogs so it was ok but for someone that doesn't..... Would not go back here until they get fully moved or opened.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: After going to the outlet mall we got a little thirsty we had already ordered some other food but we're unable to eat it within the restaurant so we called and asked awkward crew if we could order some of the beer and use your patio to eat our food they were very accommodating very nice people we even got to try to of their beers which tasted great

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: They've thought about everything at this brewery.  Great food, live music, seating inside, outside, and UPSTAIRS on the deck!  When the weather is right, they have the big glass garage doors open.  Yeah, they brew their own beer here and they have a decent selection.  It's not your typical brewery where you can just stroll in and choose the table you want to sit at.  That's because they have full table service for food and drinks.  I prefer breweries that let you wander around from the bar, to an outside table, to an inside table, and then back again - you know, rinse, lather, and repeat (relaxed and unstructured - I need that once in a while).  If you just want to stop in for a quick beer, you can sit at the bar.  The bar is quite large but also very popular with the college crowd, so it's hard to get a seat at times.   Now to the serious stuff - the beer!  I've had their Kolsch (San Marcos Blonde) and their Vienna Lager.  The blonde was the run of the mill Kolsch, not bad by any means, but the Vienna Lager - wow!  It had a great malty taste to it.  I liked it so much that I purchased a crowler of it to take home.  I rarely do that, so that tells you it must be good.  Enough useless banter - here's everything else you need to know about this place:  Free parking lot right next door or free 2 hr street parking.   Patio areas in the front and the back with overhead infrared heaters and fans with misters (they have both Texas seasons covered).  This place is popular with the college kids - TOO popular.  Growler refills are $12 or $18 for 64 oz, and $24 or $36 for 128 oz, depending on the beer you select.    Crowlers to go:  $8 or $10 (depending on the beer).  You can get three for $20 or $25 (depending on the beer).  Plenty of food options.   And I almost forgot to tell you - they have a FULL bar, not just beer!

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: Aquabrew is definitely a gem in San Marcos. I learned about it through the purchase of the brewery tour on Groupon. The tour was quaint because it's not that big, but very interesting.  The gentleman who gave the tour seemed a bit rushed at the end, but he answered our questions and seemed very knowledgeable.   At the end of the tour we got to sample some beer. They also have a beer club where you buy a growler, we got the one for $100, and join their beer club. You get a punch card for 10 refills on the growler. My husband and I got one each for $200. I was thinking it an "okay" deal i guess. Truthfully I wasn't that thrilled cause of the price. But OMG!!!! IT IS WELL WORTH EVERY PENNY FOLKS!!!!.   Aquabrew has some of the best beers around. I am Army and have lived and traveled all over the world and this lil place holds its ground when it comes to beers! Purchasing the growler is the best deal too.   I have not had the food yet, but the place is always busy and people seem to love it. And they have some of the cutest guys behind the bar.  In all, I give this gem an A+

reviews.author: Maggie M.
reviews.description: Used to be my favorite restaurant in San mo but returned recently and they have the weirdest vibe now. None of their food is offered (you get two options from a backyard stand) standoffish servers and a gloomy vibe. Sooooo disappointed and hope to see this place make it back to its prime.

reviews.author: Steve S.
reviews.description: The first thing about AquaBrew that I enjoyed was the vibe. This place really has a community feel with longer style tables and an incredible open patio with fans and lighting, ping pong and live music... and of course... beer.  The food was very flavorful. Thai chicken had good spice and the chicken thigh was tender and juicy. The Margarita flatbread was fresh tasting. The arugula salad was huge and bursting with fruits and flavor.  The beer was excellent and just what you'd expect from an onsite brewery.   Overall, if you're looking for a fun place for you and your peeps to chill, eat and drink in San Marcos... you'd do well to try this place. Plus it's right up the street from the Cheetham St warehouse.

reviews.author: Kris N.
reviews.description: My fiancé and I had an amazing experience at aquabrew. We got to talk a lot with the brewer CJ and he's extremely smart and knows what he's doing. We tried at least 6 of the different drafts and were impressed by them all. I definitely recommend this place if your wanting to experience a new brewery to checkout!

reviews.author: Jesse M.
reviews.description: The beer was good but the food was not. Should have known better than to order the steak at a bar like restaurant but it was basically inedible. Not even my 11 year old daughter would eat it. Supposed to be medium and came through well done. The waitress asked and I told her it was cooked bad and we couldn't eat it and she said "yeah I saw that" and proceeded to do absolutely nothing to fix it or make it right.   I'll go there for the beer but never again for the food

reviews.author: Robert A.
reviews.description: The beer was good, but not many choices on the menu. The restaurant is clean and has a good vibe. The food.... well it looked good. The taste... somewhat bland. My son likes it but he lost his tastebuds in an accident as a child.   I would come back for the beer and appetizers, but would pass on the dinner.

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: Service - 5/5 great customer service ! Our waiter was very attentive and met all our needs.  Atmosphere - 4/5 pretty nice place . Long tables instead of individual tables to encourage people to meet new people ! Which is a really awesome concept . Also there's a large bar since it's also a brewery.  Food- my food was about a 3.5/5 , but my friends was a solid 1. Her salmon Benedict had almost uncuttable biscuit since it was so hard , and the most burnt potatoes I've ever seen. My food which was the stuffed French toast was pretty yummy, but not a lot to it.  Noise level - 1/5 THE BAND WAS SOOO LOUD. I couldn't here my friend talking 1 foot in front of me :(  Price - 2/5 wayyyy overpriced for what you get. My French toast was 11.91 and my friends meal was 15.91  Probably won't return unless it's for a group outing , but still a cool little place to check out !

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Odd to see the plethora of reviews stating that the service here in subpar, as this was definitely not the case when I went yesterday. Easy to get a seat and our waitress was very attentive, despite it being happy hour and slightly busy on a Friday after work.  As a table, we ordered the: a) Brew House Pretzel - Amazingly soft and the beer queso is a great pairing  b) AB Bacon Jam Fries - HOLY! The bacon jam itself is something I've never had before and I must say this makes it a must return for me  c) Glass of Imperial Pilsner - Smooth and pretty standard for a Pilsner  d) Glass of Artificial Intelligence Tripel (9.72% ABV) - Yeah...the ABV tells the story itself  This spot has a great atmosphere, very rustic and cozy. Definitely a nice place, just wish you could order directly from the bar for faster access to beer.

reviews.author: Kevin E.
reviews.description: Great location and cool venue. It's evident a lot of time and thought were put into this place.   Great beers, especially liked the Ape-ricot Wheat.   I wish I saved room for the Porter Ice Cream Float.   The AB burger was solid, maybe a little messy tho.  Forget the fries tho. The regular fires were under seasoned and chewy. Think Wendy's fries when you  don't finish them at lunch and try to eat them at the end of your shift. Bleh  The staff was super friendly.   The outdoor portion looks great but a bit too hot out today to go and enjoy it.

reviews.author: Tom C.
reviews.description: You know when someone takes a picture of themselves and posts it on Instagram,and it's at just the right angle to make them look super attractive? The Yelp reviews of this place kind of remind me of that. It's not that it was bad, but I was expecting a lot more.  The highlight of my meal was the Mosaic IPA. Balanced and drinkable, this beer was really enjoyable. I also tried the Swine Dive IPA. The taste of this was a little too clean for an IPA and just didn't have the hoppy depth to add to its character. Not bad, but I wouldn't get it again.  Overall the food I ordered was really lackluster. I didn't hate it, but it certainly wasn't a memorable meal. My chicken empanadas were oily, and had very little chicken in the filling. The whole thing struck me as more of acorn dog egg roll hybrid, and didn't really seem like an empanada at all. I was grateful for the spicy sauce it was served with, which was pretty tasty. I also ordered the brussel sprouts. There were some decent flavors here, but I would have really preferred them to have a little more char on them. They came across as slightly undercooked and worse yet, very wet. A little crispness would have gone a long way.  Service was fair, friendly enough but really on the slow side. It took me almost a half an hour to get my food and it wasn't crowded. The couple at the bar sitting next to me ordered hamburgers. I have to admit I was a little jealous because they looked good. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing. Maybe it was a bad night. Whatever the reason I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.

reviews.author: Jan C.
reviews.description: Unfortunately the new menu and chef drops the rating from 5 to 4. Still friendly waitstaff and excellent happy hour. But the reason I come to AquaBrew and recommend it to everyone I meet is the food. The "new" salmon dish isn't even close to the goodness of the previous balsamic salmon with veggies. Dry. Lacked flavor. Sticky rice instead of the delish potatoes and only green beans instead of a mix of seasonal veggies. Hubby had the tostadas and 'meh' reaction. Will give it one more try before relegating it to happy hour only place with 3 stars. So sad.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: What an awkward night...Our server did not check on us. We had to continue to ask for things...multiple times, from multiple people. That portion of the night really sucked.  Howeverrrr, the street corn, queso, crispy tuna, edamame, and loaded fried were reallyyyy good. We especially loved the street corn. I wish we would've gotten the delicious food on time, instead of having to remind the staff multiple times butttt at least it tasted amazing??   I can't give them more stars even though the food was great because service is so so so important.

reviews.author: Emari S.
reviews.description: Omg I tried their Shrimp and Grits and they were delicious  and I Also tried their bacon jam fries and they were impeccable. I really enjoyed the margarita I had and the atmosphere was nice. Are usually never think of AquaBrew to eat at, but now that I finally tried it, I will definitely go back! Love it! The shrimp and grits is super buttery but I LOVE IT

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: Just left after lunch. Cute/hip spot with friendly staff.   We ordered the AB burger and I did an upgrade to their bacon jam fries ($4 upgrade). I was so excited to try these fries but they were very underwhelming to me. $4 is steep for an up charge but had I enjoyed them I wouldn't have minded. The burger was the best bite on the table. It was small in size but very juicy and tasty. Not one to split.   Next up was the fried chicken and eggs. It has so many things I typically like - fried chicken, cream gravy, bacon jam, eggs, but I didn't like this dish. It lacked dimension of flavor. It needed something. The herbed fries that came with it were good. I liked them better than the $4 bacon jam ones.   Our kids split the stuffed French toast. The only ate a little bit because it was too sweet. If a kid thinks something is too sweet you know it's toooooo sweet. Neither ate it. It was a waste of money.   Overall I'm glad we tried it but don't need to return on our own accord.

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: I was very excited to come to this brewery today!  The waitress we had was very friendly, but what bothered me was the male kitchen staff. We saw a guy walk from the kitchen with a bottle of what looked like vodka and went outside to their outside area and was playing around.   The food was DELICIOUS!! My husband got the fried chicken sandwich and I got the pulled pork sandwich. He for regular fries for his side and i got a sweet potato. We weren't a fan of the regular fries, so I highly recommend the sweet potato.   We also ordered the mimosa flight and were kinda impressed. For $20 you get a whole bottle of champagne and 4 different flavor options. We chose chipotle pineapple, watermelon, passion fruit and lavender. All amazing.   This place is spacious. The food is amazing. I was just unimpressed with a few waitstaff/bar staff members. We went next door to Chances afterwards and they mentioned the management has gone down hill.   I hadn't mentioned we aren't from the area. We are from Austin. This place had stellar food and for a night shift it wasn't awful. Give them a shot!!

name: Gruene River Grill
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday

reviews.author: Ana M.
reviews.description: one of my go to restaurants and it's a comforts place for me and my friends. whenever we have guests from out of town this is one of the first places i bring them because the food is so so good. i like how they use yelp to save spots in line so we don't have to wait there or go in person in order to join the list.  the cheese sticks as an appetizer are amazing, especially the marinara because it's like sweet.  as for entrees the balsamic ribeye is my favorite ever. the gorgonzola burger is also amazing, i think they changed it from when i first had it  (because the cheese used to be like really creamy and it was amazing and then i got it and it wasn't the same) , so i haven't ordered it again but the steak is my favorite.  i had a friend get the tortilla soup and she said it was the best she had ever had. the jalapeño crawfish chowder was really good but it was super spicy so i gave it to my dad.  as for sides their french fries are amazing and so are their loaded mashed potatoes.  i'm always so full leaving here and i don't think i've ever been able to get a desert but hopefully i'll eventually get to try one

reviews.author: Danielle G.
reviews.description: We had a great time for lunch here! A nice casual ambience with minimal to average noise depending where you sit. The location is beautiful, sitting right on the Guadalupe River! Our server Bri was kind, knowledgable, and prompt. We enjoyed our experience overall.  My spouse and I split the balsamic ribeye and it was totally delicious. Cooked perfectly and so, so yummy! The 16 oz was plenty to share between us both and it came with a good portion of both the potatoes and green beans. Everything was stellar and we ate it all up! I would 100% recommend this dish (we had it cooked medium rare and it was *chef's kiss*).  For drinks - I ordered the French pear martini, which was yummy but quite sweet. I'd likely try something else next time we're here! My spouse ordered the Rattler, which was great! Tart, but not too strong. They enjoyed it and said they'd order it again.  A delightful spot in Gruene that we'd definitely recommend!   Bonus - they have a military discount, if that applies to you.

reviews.author: Monty W.
reviews.description: We visited Gruene River Grill for the first time on a Friday afternoon, before a concert at Whitewater Amphitheater. We were very fortunate to get good parking spot and was promptly seated by the nice hostess.  We started off with a couple of cocktails, The Rattler and a frozen Margarita. Both were delicious. For appetizers, we split the Shrimp Wantons. Holy Moly were they delicious. Seriously, one of the better things I've eaten in a long while.   For our main courses, my wife had the Oriental Salad and I had the Beef Fajita Street Tacos. My wife loved her salad. The beef fajita tacos were simply fantastic.   We will definitely be back the next time we are in the area. The service was great, the drinks were refreshing and the food was delicious. 5 stars from me.  *Sorry no photos, too hungry to snag a pic!

reviews.author: Food4 Y.
reviews.description: Have you ever ate an appetizer that not only made you think, "mmmm", but physically say it out loud?  Well,  full disclosure - this dip is indulgent. Not that you'd expect anything else from this dip! We all fought over the last creamy crunchy bite, oh yes, this dip is served with tortilla chips and it's gluten free for those that have an intolerance like me! The yummy wedge salad with added bacon and blue cheese rounded out my "cheesy" meal at GRG! Oh, I almost forgot, for those that like prosecco, they've got it! Thank you to our attentive servers, Carson and Alex! Now, if y'all could just make me a gluten free chicken fried steak ;-) Cheers!

reviews.author: Kyle S.
reviews.description: We went to Gruene River Grill our first night after moving into town. It was a great start to our new life here. Kerrington was our waitress. She was one of the best waitresses we've had in a long time. She knew the menu very well and recommended great food. The decor of the restaurant is very cool. I had the Gorgonzola burger and my husband had the Gruene chicken enchiladas. Both were very good. The enchiladas were a little spicy but not too much. The burger was also very good. I definitely recommend Gruene River Grill and Kerrington.

reviews.author: Ravanne H.
reviews.description: My family visited GRG for lunch today and it was a disappointing experience. When we walked up to request a table, the host rolled his eyes when we asked for a table of 8. I suppose we were an inconvenience to him less than 15 minute into his shift? Although there were at least 5 staff members gathered behind the hostess stand - some talking amongst themselves, some on their phone - not a single one asked if we needed a high chair or booster even though we had a small child with us so we grabbed the high chair and two boosters and still not a single staff member offered to help.   Our waitress was kind to our face (and we tipped her as such), but not knowing my husband was waiting for us to get back from the restroom, she complained to her fellow coworkers about us loud enough for him to hear. She complained that we had children with us, complained that we mentioned our poor experience with how we were greeted and then rounded out her rant with a "ugh, tourists". We aren't tourists. We live 5 miles down the road. Even if we were, what a horrid way to be treated by the locals?   I cut my teeth in the service industry and this kind of service / customer experience would've never been tolerated. I understand children are frustrating to serve. I understand that nobody wants to be at work on a Sunday afternoon. But I learned as a waitress to leave my bad attitude at the door and at the bare minimum, show a little class even on days I didn't want to.   I'd strongly advise your staff to be a bit more careful in their treatment of your guests because in driving away your local patrons, you'll be reliant on those "ugh, tourists" they seem to dislike so much.   What a shame.

reviews.author: Aaron H.
reviews.description: Great views, mediocre food and weak drinks.  Stunning views overlooking the creek, great looking restaurant but franchise food is better.

reviews.author: Toni S.
reviews.description: I really wanted to try a steak house tonight so we ran across Greene River Grill and everything looked good. They served Texas size portions for sure! We ordered the trifecta appetizer, then I had the Balsamic Ribeye because I love ribeye steak! And Hubby had the Chicken Fried Chicken which is one of his favorites at other restaurants.   The trifecta was really good. I loved the salsa and queso. Hubby loved the guacamole (I am not a fan). The steak was good at first but then I noticed that al you can taste is the balsamic vinegar. The meat was tender but there was not flavor. The green beans and red potatoes were good. Green beans had a little kick to them. The chicken fried chicken was ok. Not really seasoned. Hubby added salt and pepper. The mashed potatoes and corn were REALLY GOOD!   Overall, we have plenty for tomorrow's dinner but we will try another steak house. May try to get something else here when we come back to shop.

reviews.author: Edna G.
reviews.description: Gruene River Grill is a place for hanging out, great outdoor ambiance and great food! Oh and Gruene is sounded like 'Green'?!  LOL That threw me off by the locals around here telling us.  Going to Gruene downtown was a  small nice town with lots of lights on their streets and big trees, hearing bands play music and small local stores to shop.  Some houses were converted to bed and breakfast places or stores. Unfortunately, we came on a weekday but the place was still crowded.  The parking lot of Gruene River Grill was large and the parking was full but we got lucky. When dining, ask to sit in the causal river dining area versus indoor. We came at perfect timing before sunset and overlooking the river.   Our server was very friendly and hospitable. Love the Texan accent but I forgot his name to give him credit. They have the downloadable menu scan to see the menu.  This is common now since Covid 19 started.  They do have happy hours on weekdays from 3:30p-6:30p and we missed it.   With many friends to order, it was great to try every dish they had.  We ordered many things and these were my ratings of eat: Peach Bellini (5 - a must try as its strong and good) Cucumber Mojitos (5) Cesar Side Salad (4) Crawfish Jalapeño Chowder (5 - a must try!!) Redfish (4.5 - a little bit salty on some parts but flavors are good) Filet Gorgonzola Mignon (5 -  a must try as its tender and love the blend of this cheese on meat) Balsamic Rib Eye (5 - their signature dish) Country Fried Steak (5 - crispy, moist and huge portion!)  All dishes, sides like green beans and potato wedges were very well cooked. Definitely, come here to try their food and enjoy their ambiance as I definitely recommend them. [14th/100]

reviews.author: Kevin Z.
reviews.description: Enjoyed our meal.  Extensive menu, huge portions, great service and nice atmosphere.  Definitely worth returning!

reviews.author: Celeste P.
reviews.description: First time here and really enjoyed it. Laidback atmosphere right next to the river, we sat inside as It was a bit chilly though. We ordered the shrimp wantons, jalapeño pork chops, southwest meatloaf, the lobster chowder and a side of steamed vegetables for a weaning baby!  Everything was delicious, we both took home half our plates and had enough for lunch the next day.   room for improvement would lie in the bathrooms, no changing table and unless there were more bathrooms somewhere there's only 2 stalls.

reviews.author: Erin L.
reviews.description: This restaurant was recommended to my fiancé by one of his coworkers.  We got to the restaurant around 4 on a Sunday and got seated immediately.  For an appetizer we had shrimp wontons, which I highly recommend.  I had a hard time deciding what I wanted for dinner.  There were a lot of different entrees that sounded good to me, but I decided to go with their blackened redfish with crawfish Dijon peppercorn sauce served on a bed of basmati rice and a side of Asian slaw.  It usually comes with vegetable medley, but I substituted that with the Asian slaw, which is a favorite of mine.  My fiancé had the 16 oz ribeye seared in butter and balsamic vinegar with green beans and garlic crispy red potatoes.  We had dessert as well and chose the banana pudding, which is one of my favorite desserts and their's was amazing.    We really enjoyed The Gruene River Grill.  The atmosphere was nice, our waiter was kind and very attentive, and it was a clean restaurant.  I definitely recommend this restaurant.  They have a wide variety of different entrees for everyone, from tacos, to steaks, to seafood, and entrees with an oriental twist.  We are looking forward to going back and trying some different entrees ourselves.  As far as price goes, it was reasonable, especially for the portion size and quality of the food.  I've heard this restaurant gets pretty busy, and they do not accept reservations.  If you go on a weekend, I recommend going sometime in the early afternoon.

reviews.author: Nia P.
reviews.description: As always, the food is amazing! The wait is never terribly long but I would recommend checking the waitlist and putting your name down. The employees are always polite. They also have outdoor seating and it's beautiful! There's also plenty of window seating if you prefer to sit inside or if it's raining.

reviews.author: Joseph D.
reviews.description: Fantastic food! Fantastic service! Fantastic views! That pretty much summarizes our dinner party buffet at Gruene Grill!!    We had about 35 people for a 70th Birthday party which they catered for use. We were given the downstairs room which greets with a panoramic view of the river below (I mean DIRECTLY below!! It's amazing how steep the hill is)    Our 2 servers were absolutely amazing, friendly, outgoing and extremely courteous. They went out of their way to bring us food that was not originally on the buffet line to help accommodate picky eaters (the kids lol)    The food was out if this world good!! We had Santfe chicken, smoothered steal, mashed potatoes and green beans. The steak was so tender I only needed my fork to cut through it!! Everything else was amazing and flavorful as well.    I can't wait to come back again!!

reviews.author: Laney S.
reviews.description: Service was great. Weather was perfect for outdoor seating. The filet was perfectly cooked but personally didn't care for the sauce (just a personal preference). The chicken enchiladas were good.

reviews.author: Eloy G.
reviews.description: Visited this place while we were in the area visiting Gruene and around the water. I had the catfish plate and it was on point. Good size portion and the taste was good along with the fries. My guest had the chicken fried steak that was a huge portion and also very good because I tried it. The green beans were great as well. Had the spinach and artichoke dip and that was pretty tasty as an appetizer. Overall this was a very good meal. Lastly finished off dinner with a carrot cake that had very good flavor. Overall I will definitely be back! This place does it right and had great customer service by Anna our server.

reviews.author: Gem T.
reviews.description: First of all, this restaurant is beautiful. It is huge and the view is amazing. It's perfect for date. The staff were friendly. There was a line when we got there for dinner but it went fast. We were given a window table and it was a  breathtaking view. Of course, I had to try their peach Bellini. It was sooooo refreshing and gave me a nice little buzz. For starters, we had their home made cheese  sticks and bowl of jalapeno crawfish chowder. Both were very good but the chowder stole the show. My kiddo rated their cheese sticks "the best she has ever had". We figured if their appetizers were that good, the entrees were probably better.  Unfortunately, they were not. The country  fried steak was huge but it was bland, gristly with a bland and burnt tasting gravy. The corn that came with it was delicious though. My fried catfish was moist and fresh but bland yet again. The Asian slaw and fries that came with it were good though. The chicken Guadalupe, I was told was ok.  All in all, we liked this restaurant but might stick to appetizers or try something else next time. It is also worth noting that they are supporters of the Wounded Warrior Project and provide military discount as well.

reviews.author: Katheryn T.
reviews.description: Amazing view, food, and service. Nice charming little restaurant. The outdoor seating has a nice view of the River.

reviews.author: Sydney S.
reviews.description: The fried catfish is to die for! They catch the biggest and freshest ones. Get the spinach and artichoke dip to start off with. And definitely recommend the Asian slaw if you want to try something new. You get to see the Guadalupe river from windows or patio. And the service is terrific!

reviews.author: Dave H.
reviews.description: Ok, so this place is really cool. It's in a historically old rustic building (think big bar like), right along the Guadeloupe river. The menu is pretty diverse- we tried the enchiladas, the chicken Guadeloupe, and the oriental shrimp salad. All were amazingly tasty. Sean , our server, make sure our glasses were never empty. He made the suggestions on the meals and he was spot on. If you're down in Gruene , you have to give this restaurant a try. I'd give it five stars.

name: Alpine Haus Restaurant
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: I don't have a drop of German Blood in me and I certainly haven't eaten in Germany (yet).  However, I have been to a few fairly respected German Restaurants here in Central TX and this was the best meal of that particular faire I have had.  We drove 1-1/2 hrs down to New Braunfels from Williamson County and it was worth it. I had the Sausage Plate, Weisswurst (veal) and Bratwurst (pork).  It comes with sauerkraut and the German Potato Salad.  The Potato Salad was awesome.  This potato salad is room temp and vinegary (you know if you have had German Potato Salad before).  It's not the creamy cold type you might get at a BBQ Joint.  Before the entree was served we had a cup of Cream of Mushroom Soup, very delicious. The menu is not huge but it seems to cover the range of faire you expect at a German Restaurant.  There is no children's menu or any Non-German dishes i.e. hamburgers, chicken tenders, etc. So everybody in your group needs to like German Food or be open to trying it.  We'll be back for sure.

reviews.author: Misha S.
reviews.description: Pros:  1. Service is great! Knowledgable, excited staff  2. Restaurant is adorable - love the location right by everything - super easy to walk to a bakery or around downtown   3. The food is DELICIOUS. From the rye bread, the schnitzels and sausages, and ESPECIALLY the black forest cake. Seriously, the best I've ever had.    Cons:   1. They run out of the Black Forest cake. Seriously. I went here on my birthday, and they run out of it at the beginning of the week usually. And it's REALLY the best. I hope they start making MOOOOREEE!   2. It's a little pricey, but the portions are huge and sharing is definitely easy.

reviews.author: Daniel M.
reviews.description: So far, I really like this place. Live music in this spot is on the spot ( I am Hard of hearing ).  The waiter is amazingly, I do appreciate him check on us and food is on the spot ! I am Chef ....   However,  if Chef Ramsay were here. He will said first thing out his mouth is taking away the scents. It's need to remove and allow the smell from the kitchen brew it.

reviews.author: Daniel M.
reviews.description: Wife was hungry for German food and we used to go yearly for 5 weeks stays each time to Germany!  Picked this place and really enjoyed the service and selection of items!  The rye bread was really great! Then I had garlic soup that was good. The Wife wanted to try the sausage sampler. They had the spicy mustard I like. The only problem I had is, I've never had jalapeño sausage in Germany!! Not my thing.  Then I had the Rinder Goulash that was really great, the Wife had Huhnerbrust Geschnetzeltes. Chicken breast with sautéed spinach with mushrooms that was good as well!  I really like the place. I wish Yelp allowed 3 1/2 stars. Would I go back, you bet!

reviews.author: Alyssa L.
reviews.description: We loved the excellent food. The rye bread is amazing and the accordion musician was such a delight. We will definitely come back

reviews.author: Amberly F.
reviews.description: First timers here. We took our daughters 9 and 7 to have some of this amazing cuisine. I will start with the things we lived and work up to what wasn't the best. Firstly the series's great. The waitress was friendly and the place very clean. Beautiful ambiance perfect for a date or a couples dinner night. The food was good both my girls and husband agree it was yummy. All of our food came correct and hot. The beer was cold and the bread was fresh. Something to note while this is not a dress up place it's easy to feel under dressed. Also, this is a great place to try new things but the price is high and the options limited. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a quiet dinner with good food. As far as the food it was a little salty but flavorful. The sausage mustard was to die for and the red cabbage was absolutely delicious. We left full and satisfied.

reviews.author: Mimi P.
reviews.description: Best German food in Texas! Loved everything we ordered and the ambient! We even enjoyed the music playing live. Absolutely recommend this restaurant.  10 out of 10 baby!

reviews.author: Phillip D.
reviews.description: Great reviews, great little restaurant.  Many of our usual favorites were on the menu. My better half got Yagerschnitzel and I tried the Zeguenerschnitzel. We both were blown away! We both got the  chicken version. We both got the potato salad and red cabbage both were good but the potato salad was not traditional. It was good. The bread was just sliced marble Rye.  Our service was great and attentive. Our guy was Callan. Made it very pleasant.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: HOLY MERCY!  This place was awesome, and eat lots of German food.  This was truly one of the best places I have eaten German EVER.  The food and service were wonderful, and much better than many of the other local German haunts.    I HIGHLY suggest trying this one out.    Excellent food, excellent service, and the young man who was playing the accordion around the restaurant was wonderful too!  Get yourself a reservation first, preferably!

reviews.author: Evan B.
reviews.description: This is the most legit jager schnitzel I've ever had. Delicious. They forgot my side of spatzle and the potato salad was cold when I thought it was supposed to be served hot but we also came fairly late at night. The sausage sampler was great but the sausage was no different than sausage I could have bought from a grocery store and made at home. Our service was incredible though and the building is awesome and a historical site.

reviews.author: Andrew P.
reviews.description: My grandparents are from Vienna Austria. I grew up on authentic Germanic foods. The decor in the restaurant was nice and reminded me of my grandparents house when I was a young man. The service here was exceptional. Very friendly, very professional and well mannered wait staff. If you want a kind of modern take on this cultural fare then maybe it's good, but old school authentic German food it is not. First of all the Kartoffel Knoedel were more of a grainy mashed potato that was scooped into a ball form. If you've had legit potato dumplings you'd know that these are not them.  Spatzel was meh. Beef goulash with Hungarian spicy paprika. Kudos for using the Hungarian spicy paprika. But why the hell is the sauce tomato based with bell peppers? If that's what you're looking for then maybe not too bad, but again, not traditional.   Jagerschnitzel was okay. Sauce wasn't the greatest.  I didn't hate the place, it's just it didn't excite the palate.

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: My wife and I went for a date night.  The food was delicious.  I usually get the schnitzel but chose the Hungarian goulash instead.   It like the schnitzel was so well prepared.   The service was very friendly and quick to replenish our glasses.

reviews.author: Tonya T.
reviews.description: Beautiful old house, fabulous food and personable waitstaff. We had a tasty roasted garlic soup and sausage sampler before our meal.  A variety. Of lunch choices. Desserts looked delicious but we were just too full

reviews.author: Brian C.
reviews.description: As close to eating in Bavaria that you will get!  Very, VERY good!   I travel around the US for a living and have tried dozens of German restaurants and this is the real deal. I was stationed in Germany in the Army and have been trying to find a decent German restaurant for a loooong time. This is it!

reviews.author: may z.
reviews.description: What a little gem! Husband and I first discovered this restaurant during the "Texas freeze" back in February while staying at the Gruene Cottages (also recommend!); and it turned what would have been a sad trip to escape our lack of utilities into a lovely memorable date night. The restaurant was full throughout the evening, patrons being entertained by an accordion player that serenaded guests table side. A limited menu showing focus pays off, everything we have tried is delicious. Overall, a great neighborhood spot that we frequently visit!

reviews.author: Chris H.
reviews.description: Two times I've tried to get food there and both times, I have been shot down. I have to get to go because my wife is paralyzed from waist down, I went one time to dine in at 7:30 and was told they were not taking customers on a Friday, call and was told they are not taking phone orders. For a industry that was in dire straits last year I find this a poor decision. I've eaten there a few time and it was fair, I miss friesen haus it was at least flavored unlike this place mushrooms gravy that elder eats raved about its bland and lack luster and small portions.

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: This little cottage restaurant has the potential to be a absolutely great German restaurant. However, it has a little house work to do to get there. No doubt it has the charming ambience and Great German food of the best restaurants in the country.   Here is a list of minor items that needs to take care of first.  1. A vase of plastic flowers on the tables needs to have real flowers. 2. The bread needs to be changed to a better hearty German bread instead of the white bread with brown swirls. 3. Do not simply dump a small pile of foil-wrap butter pads, but have a real butter server with the bread. 4. The service on a Sunday afternoon was deplorable. The young man probably was a student from TSU in nearby San Marcos, working on weekends to make a little money for college. He did not repeat the orders from the four of us and therefore our food came all mixed up. He never thought to refill any of our drinks until we finally ask him to. He was a nice of guy  but just not trained to be a true sophisticated food server like this little restaurant deserves.  By the way, having a young singer with real lederhosen amble through the dining rooms singing German songs with his accordion was brilliant. This restaurant is truly a little gem that simply needs to be polished.

reviews.author: Kristin P.
reviews.description: THE BEST GERMAN FOOD!!! If you have not been here do yourself a favor and try it. The food is incredible. Atmosphere is really charming and we love the musician playing the accordion.  Some of my favorites here are the jager schnitzel with spaetzle. At lunch the schnitzel sandwich, which I add a side of jager gravy to pour over the schnitzel and then put the bread back on top. So yummy!

reviews.author: Tracy N.
reviews.description: The Almond crusted Brie appetizer was a meal by itself. I love the Schnitzel I had. I cannot pronounce or spell it but it had a spicy paprika sauce and it was spicy and delicious. My husband had Jaeger schnitzel  with dumplings that were out of this world. They had a young man playing accordion and it was great music to hear. We chatted with him a bit. The house is cozy and beautiful.

reviews.author: Patrick T.
reviews.description: I would highly recommend this place. I was in New Braunfels for a completely different reason and this caught my attention. The staff is friendly. They are attentive. And the food is out of this world. It is wonderful to have a few delicious bites from abroad. The fried Brie was so good. I'd highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for German foods. I would also recommend it to anyone. It was a journey for the tastebuds.

name: Gristmill River Restaurant
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Dakota G.
reviews.description: Walked into the Gristmill about 7:55 P.M. on New Year's Eve 2021, not really expecting to be seated.  Surprisingly, the hostesses were very accommodating, and promised us the outside seating we requested "in about 20 minutes".  We were seated in five. Our server, Morgan, a lovely  young woman, a college student at a Texas University,  was impeccable in carrying out her duties, she gave us much better service one might expect on such a busy night as this was.  Everything was perfect, from the seating, to the food - onion rings, tortilla soup, the bronze catfish and the baby back ribs were all excellent. It was an amazingly wonderful experience made so by a diligent and attentive wait staff. Totally recommend the Gristmill River Restaurant

reviews.author: Tanya B.
reviews.description: We had so much fun at this restaurant! They are currently redoing the back so all of the seating was inside.. they had a nice warm fire going.. great views of the river inside.  It did get pretty toasty inside thankfully one of the waitresses came over and opened up the windows..   I ordered the steak salad and my friend ordered the chicken salad sandwich..  The steak salad was good, there was a handful of the lettuce that should have been tossed out not tossed into the salad which is why this isn't 5 stars.. The steak was good super tender!  We both loved the chicken salad sandwich.. it's not sweet which made it different and even more delicious!  I almost forgot the onion rings! I would absolutely order those again! Only able to eat one so I'd order the small but sooo good and not very oily at all!

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: Food was amazing but the service was lackluster. I will just blame covid. We ordered the onion rings as appetizers. Obviously we were forgotten. Ours appetizer finally arrived and then our meals 1-2 minutes later.   Good thing the onion rings were amazing. I had the chicken fried chicken and it was cooked perfectly and had a nice seasoning. The flat potato fries were a pleasant surprise with the perfect amount of seasoning salt.

reviews.author: Christii L.
reviews.description: If it wasn't for the view/location, I think I can totally rate it as 1, or if any.    The food was not the tastiest thing I have had. It was decent. It is as average as going to Jim's/IHOP (please don't be offended if you are a fan). But the price you have to pay for a side of onion rings (picture below), it was $11.99. Honestly, they were genuinely crazy prices for the quality and quantity.   The customer service is extremely bad. We were walked into our seated area. No one greeted us at a table until about 30-40 minutes in, and that's after we tried to get their attention. No one ever came back to check on us after the food was delivered, and we were even having a hard time to get the check. I personally wouldn't go back again.

reviews.author: Jessica R.
reviews.description: The one spot to grab a bite when you are in Gruene.  I enjoy the nice outdoor seating and view of nature. I had the margarita which was tasty and topped off with edible flowers.  The pulled pork sandwich was enough to share.  November is a great time of year to shop, eat, and enjoy the beautiful little town.

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: Must see! Everyone that comes to Gruene has been to the Gristmill. It is located right next to Gruene Hall and the water tower. This building is historic and used to be the cotton gin. I enjoy looking at the building every time I come here. I included a bunch of pictures so you can see the charm of this place.  I got seated right away but if you are coming on a weekend be prepared for a little bit of a wait. They do not do reservations so plan ahead. The good thing is that they have a ton of shaded outdoor seating if you have to wait. For an added bonus you can often hear the music from Gruene Hall.  I ordered the club with fries and it was great. Their fries are the best and I have never had a bad experience here. My wife also got the club sandwich and she loved it.   I have also done work events here and you can rent a room in the back. The service is always great which is nice being this is a tourist attraction.  If you haven't been here before then you have to put this on your itinerary while in Gruene. You won't regret it!

reviews.author: Damian P.
reviews.description: Cute aesthetic. Very big. Menu and food is fairly decent. Pricing can be a bit much. In terms of how sanitary it is, could definitely use some attention. Staff is friendly, however, many former employees have come forward to talk about how poor and cruel the management is. Not a good working environment.

reviews.author: Nina C.
reviews.description: This was probably the coolest restaurant that I went to while around San Antonio area.  This was actually previously a factory of some sort many moons ago.  It looked as if not much was changed from the original, or they just made it look that way.  I have to say, if you like AC while eating then it's best to find another restaurant.  They have fans and shade.  So when you walk in, it's right in the town of Gruene (pronounced Green), you can easily park in the little towns parking lot and just walk (if you're able).  My aunt informed me to NEVER come on the weekend or you'll be waiting a very long time because it's a hot spot.  Off to the side of the building there are countless benches that have mist oscillating fans so you don't have to pass out while waiting in the heat.  They do have live bands that come for entertainment, and an outside bar to order drinks while you wait.  I mean, if you have all that in the waiting area then it really must be worth it.  Luckily we sat right down on the week day.  We were given the option to choose inside or outside.  We went for outside. Now this restaurant has so many levels and stairs that lead you to the back of the building.   The waiter was fantastic, the food was incredible.  All-in-all it was a good experience.  I didn't talk too much about the food because you're more so going there for the atmosphere, and Gristmill definitely wins.

reviews.author: Steph B.
reviews.description: The Gristmill is an iconic restaurant for the Gruen (pronounced "green") New Braunfels (pronounced "new bronzefels") area.   I have been here many times and give the place 5 always because of location and ambiance and the he have had to -1 for food with the comment that sometimes the food is a five and other times it's a 3.   But I come back because it's a really cool place and when there's live music it's even more cool, yea more better.   I don't recommend the jalapeño margarita as it makes my lips hurt but I do recommend the jalapeño poppers because even tho they are hot the taste is so good you would eat them if they were shooting flames.   Have fun!

reviews.author: Alyssa L.
reviews.description: Ribs are tender, staff is friendly, and desserts were fantastic. What more could you want?

reviews.author: Christina T.
reviews.description: This restaurant used to be good. The amount of food you got was huge. They were known for their chicken fried steak. Well not anymore, it was tasteless.  The meat and gravy had no flavor. The green beans were good after you added the seasoned salt that was on the table.  It's a shame that the prices go up, portions go down and the quality goes down. The service was very slow. I found out the waitress was new and overwhelmed. We still gave her about a 30% tip because she was new.  I will say that the queso was good after we added pico to it.  Probably won't go back. So many other places are better for chicken fried steak.

reviews.author: Brian S.
reviews.description: Bacon wrapped filet and chicken fried steak were both fantastic. The onion rings were huge and very good. Spinach salad and mashed potato's both were very good  The service was very good - I just wish I wasn't so full

reviews.author: Danielle H.
reviews.description: Great place to meet with friends outdoors! Great food and drinks!!   Only thing that was bad about our experience was we had wasps wanting to come to our table the whole time.   I know it's hard to deter when you are drinking mimosas but just kinda downed the atmosphere some, the waiter seemed to help us though try to get rid of them, but not once did a manager come by to help even  though they walked by staring multiple times

reviews.author: Eric H.
reviews.description: We landed at this restaurant on our way home from an epic holiday weekend floating the Guadalupe River.. It's in Gruene,Tx near New Braunfels,Tx .. This restaurant is massive with nooks and crannies everywhere!! They also have an outdoor live music venue but unfortunately we weren't there foe the night life .. The food was delicious and the service was great  . If you go at night make sure to get in the wait list ASAP. We ate our food and then explored the town some to help digest all that good grub !! We stopped at a couple shops and got some ice cream as well !! I can't wait for our next trip to the river and this cool little town !!

reviews.author: Monty W.
reviews.description: We usually eat at the Gristmill every time we are in the area. It's pretty much our go-to. This last visit was on a Saturday evening that had a fairly big concert going on next door at Gruene Hall. We are anticipating a wait, but our quoted wait of 90 minutes turned into around 2 hours before being seated. Understandable as it's a busy place, but disappointing none the less.   We had come chips and Queso along with a frozen Sangria while we waited in the courtyard area for the text saying our table was ready. The snack was needed to keep us from getting hangry and the frozen Sangria was wonderful.   Once we were finally seated, we pretty much knew exactly what we wanted to order. No beating around the bush so to speak.   On this particular visit, we went with the Pasta Poblano Salad and the Beef Tenderloin Sandwich. They asked me how I would like the beef cooked. I requested "Medium" and they delivered. It's not your normal sandwich but man o man is it delicious!   It's summer time, peak tourist season. I fully expected a wait. I believe the staff was trying as hard as they could to get people through the door and to their table. I won't complain too much.  We'll definitely continue coming back to the Gristmill when we are in the area.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Took my wife here for her birthday today 3/1/2021. What a great old building and we felt totally safe with lots of distance. The rooms were all wonderful with the large fireplaces.   Our server was Chloe and see was very efficient and kind. My wife loved her fish but was did not love the round fries as much because she thought they were a little soggy. The crispy one were great. I ordered the chicken fried steak and it was perfect. The sauce on the side was great. The mash potatoes were very tasty but could have been hotter. I love hot food. It is a issue I have with all restaurants.   This is a beautiful building and we will definitely come back and enjoy the river once COVID is over. I bet the outdoor band areas are great in the summer. All in all much more to love about this place than minor little things.

reviews.author: Alexis S.
reviews.description: I had a pleasant visit to this restaurant. The food was delicious and yeasty. The food came in warm and pretty cook. The bathroom was clean, and the venue was well kept. Things that need improvement is on customer service. Our server, I think her name was Lexius, was sweet, but I think she was overwhelmed. We were a party of 7 people, and she rarely came and checked on us. Our drinks were not refilled, and it took us a while to receive our paycheck.
